column4: Issue Details

column3: Issue #9219: Removed redundant "Unsupported cases" section from…
column4: …VariableDeclarationUsageDistance check documentation  Solves #9219   ### Case 1: ### `$ cat Test.java` ```java public class Test {      public void foo() {         int c;          // OK, distance = 2         int a = 3;      // OK, distance = 1         int b = 2;      // OK, distance = 1         {           a = a + b;           c = b;         }     } }  ``` `$ cat check.xml` ```xml  		                         ```  `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c` ``` Starting audit... Audit done. ```  As expected, the check does not raise violation because maximum allowed distance = 3.  ### Case 2: ### `$ cat Test.java` ```java public class Test {     boolean res;      public void foo() {         int sum = 0;            // OK, distance = 3                  for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++) {             a++;             b--;             sum++;                          if (sum > 10) {               res = true;             }         }     } } ``` `$ cat check.xml` ```xml  		                         ```  `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c` ``` Starting audit... Audit done. ```  As expected, the check does not raise violation because max allowed distance = 3, and in the example also, distance between usage and declaration for `sum` = 3.   Also, the check does not suggest to move `sum` into the `for(...)` block, even if distance>3.  `$ cat Test.java` ```java public class Test {     boolean res;      public void foo() {         int sum = 0;            // violation, distance = 4                  for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++) {             System.out.println("Extra statement");             a++;             b--;             sum++;                          if (sum > 10) {               res = true;             }         }     } } ```  `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c` ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/CheckstyleExperiments/VariableDeclarationUsageDistance/Test.java:32:9: Distance between variable 'sum' declaration and its first usage is 4, but allowed 3. Consider making that variable final if you still need to store its value in advance (before method calls that might have side effects on the original value). [VariableDeclarationUsageDistance] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```

column3: update WriteTagCheckTest to use unique Input file in each test method
column4: WriteTagCheckTest.java file reuse some Input files few time in few different test method. Expected: each test method in Test class use it own Input file and do not share it with any other test method.  more details - https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/wiki/Good-practice-on-how-to-create-Input-files-for-tests

column3: upgrade minimal required jdk version to 11
column4: World is moving to jdk11 as minimal requirement.  Eclipse requires jdk11 - https://wiki.eclipse.org/Eclipse/Installation  Sonar requires jdk11 - https://docs.sonarqube.org/latest/requirements/requirements/ (they warning us that our sevntu project is still running under jdk8 and will stop to work very soon)  IDEA requires jdk11 - https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/installation-guide.html > You do not need to install Java to run IntelliJ IDEA, because JetBrains Runtime is bundled with the IDE (based on JRE 11). However, to develop Java applications, a standalone JDK is required.    we discussed it at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/7281 and waited for Eclipse to move to jdk11

column3: Google style false positive for internal block of code
column4: When using the google style, Checkstyle reports: `src/main/java/io/github/oliviercailloux/jaris/credentials/CredsReader.java:[186,5] (indentation) Indentation: 'block lcurly'`. It wants [that block](https://github.com/oliviercailloux/JARiS/blob/master/src/main/java/io/github/oliviercailloux/jaris/credentials/CredsReader.java#L186-L196) to be indented. That is because of the [Indentation module configuration](https://github.com/oliviercailloux/JARiS/blob/master/relaxed_google_style.xml#L245-L252), which comes straight from the original google check [corresponding configuration](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/src/main/resources/google_checks.xml#L248-L255).  (The example project uses a local variant of Google style, but I verified that using the original also exhibit the problem.)  I do not think that [Google Java Style Guide](https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html) really mandates the (IMHO odd) indentation that Checkstyle wants to enforce.  Is it possible to fix the checkstyle google style implementation, by changing the Indentation configuration or otherwise, so that those blocks can be left indented as I like them to be?  Thanks.

column3: Infra: migrate to Truth in tests
column4: We [agreed](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/7239#issuecomment-560147839) to use [Truth](https://github.com/google/truth) in tests. It is more readable and produces better diffs on failure.  This is how a regular unit test should be written: ```java     @Test     public void testFomeMethod() {         assertWithMessage("Human-readable assertion")             .that(someClass.method(arg1, arg2))             .isTrue()             .contains(...)             .isInstanceOf(...)     } ``` Assertion starts with `assertWithMessage(...)`, followed by `that` and number of [assertions](https://truth.dev/benefits#readable-assertions).  For asserting exceptions:  ```java     @Test     public void testMethodThrowsException() {         final SomeExceptionType exception =  assertThrows(SomeExceptionType.class, () -> {             someClass.someMethod(args);         });         assertWithMessage("Invalid exception message")             .that(exception)             .hasMessageThat()                 .isEqualTo("The expected message");         assertWithMessage("Invalid inner exception")             .that(exception)             .hasCauseThat()                 .isInstanceOf(...)                 .hasMessageThat()                     ...;     } ```

column3: UnnecessaryParentheses false positives in 8.42
column4: This must be related to https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/5779 -- this behavior appeared in 8.42:  ```bash $ cat TestClass.java public class TestClass {     public static void main(String[] args) {         boolean a = true;         int b = 42;         int c = 42;         System.out.println(a == (b == c));     } } ```  ```bash $ cat TestConfig.xml                                ```  ```bash $ java -jar checkstyle-8.42-all.jar -c TestConfig.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /mnt/c/Users/ipono/Downloads/__files/TestClass.java:6:33: Unnecessary parentheses around expression. [UnnecessaryParentheses] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```

column3: LineLengthCheck should check for import and package statements
column4: This is related to the fix originated in this bug: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/2433  On the first comment, I found this:  """ "imports" are not possible to line-wrap so LineLength should skip them from validation. Special option is not required for this, Javadoc/Xdoc should be updated. """  AFAIK, the JLS supports splitting the import:  ```` SingleTypeImportDeclaration:    import TypeName ;  TypeName:   TypeIdentifier   PackageOrTypeName . TypeIdentifier ```` So, an import production is of the form:  `import identifier . identifier . identifier .... ;`  ie: a sequence of tokens. AFAIK, whitespaces are accepted between tokens, so technically, you can write an import like this:  ```` import my.package.name.    MyClass; ````  I think that the LineLengthCheck check must be either modified back to the original behaviour, or at least add an option to check for line lengths on import and package statements.  ``` bash ~/.../mp/aa$ javac A.java  ~/.../mp/aa$   ~/.../mp/aa$ cat check.xml                  ~/.../mp/aa$ cat A.java  import java . util . List;  class A { };  ~/.../mp/aa$ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" ~/.../mp/aa$ java -jar ~/Downloads/checkstyle-8.42-all.jar -c check.xml A.java Starting audit... Audit done. ``` ---  I expect the check to fail:  ```` ~/.../mp/aa$ java -jar ~/Downloads/checkstyle-8.42-all.jar -c check.xml A.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/pagrana/projects/mp/aa/A.java:1: Line is longer than 20 characters (found 26). [LineLength] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors ````  ---

column3: Github actions should react with thump up (+1) emoj on message if triggered
column4: this is how dependabot works and it is really cool feature as  author of command knows if bot is actually triggered an action. Example: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9155#issuecomment-757561323  we need this feature for our github actions also. I hope dependabot is opensource and we can take this feature from its sources.

column3: Generated suppressions.xml is ignored
column4: This bug appears in version 8.40   Step 1: Set up Java file. ``` [buttarsa@ch12ldvdi302 buttarsa]$ cat Test.java  class Test {     public void onAction(String transactionId) {             System.out.println("123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 " +                             "123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 123456789 ");     } }  [buttarsa@ch12ldvdi302 buttarsa]$ javac Test.java ```  Step 2: Create checkstyle.xml ``` [buttarsa@ch12ldvdi302 buttarsa]$ cat checkstyle.xml                                                                                         ```  Step 3: Generate suppressions.xml ``` [buttarsa@ch12ldvdi302 buttarsa]$ java -jar ~/Downloads/checkstyle-8.40-all.jar com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c checkstyle.xml -g -o suppressions.xml Test.java  Checkstyle ends with 2 errors.  [buttarsa@ch12ldvdi302 buttarsa]$ cat suppressions.xml        ```  Step 4: Update checkstyle.xml so it references suppressions.xml ``` [buttarsa@ch12ldvdi302 buttarsa]$ cat checkstyle.xml                                                                                                     ```  Step 5: Run check again. The suppressions.xml is ignored. ``` [buttarsa@ch12ldvdi302 buttarsa]$ java -jar ~/Downloads/checkstyle-8.40-all.jar com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c checkstyle.xml  Test.java  Starting audit... [ERROR] /ctc/buttarsa/Test.java:3:13: 'method def' child has incorrect indentation level 12, expected level should be 8. [Indentation] [ERROR] /ctc/buttarsa/Test.java:3:155: '+' should be on a new line. [OperatorWrap] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```

column3: 8.40 Generated suppression filter file is unparseable
column4: This bug appears in version *8.40*  I configure my project with gradle:  _build.gradle_ ```gradle apply plugin: 'checkstyle'  checkstyle {     toolVersion = '8.40' } ```  _config/checkstyle/checkstyle.xml_ ```xml                                ...many other lines  ```  There are plenty of warnings in my project, so I generated a`config/checkstyle/suppression.xml` file with the command line tool: ``` java -jar ~/Downloads/checkstyle-8.40-all.jar com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c config/checkstyle/checkstyle.xml -g -o config/checkstyle/suppressions.xml .  ```  This succeeds in generating the file. But when I try to run `./gradlew clean build -x test`, my `suppressions.xml` file is unparseable:  ``` * What went wrong: Execution failed for task ':checkstyleMain'. > java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unexpected xpath query: /CLASS_DEF[./IDENT[@text='MyService']]/OBJBLOCK/METHOD_DEF[./IDENT[@text='onAction']]/SLIST/EXPR/METHOD_CALL[./IDENT[@text='ifCondition']]/ELIST/LAMBDA/SLIST/LITERAL_IF/SLIST/EXPR/METHOD_CALL/ELIST/EXPR/PLUS[./STRING_LITERAL[@text='Partially completed task id={}, transactionId={} ']] ```  If I comment out the offending rule, I can proceed, BUT my entire suppressions.xml file gets ignored.

column3: Google style doesn't allow member and parameter names that should be ok.
column4: The regex patterns in the [Google style](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/src/main/resources/google_checks.xml) for member names, parameter names, etc. do not match names with a single lower case letter at the beginning such as `xLabel`.  The member name uses this pattern: `^[a-z][a-z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9]*$` The other names use this: `^[a-z]([a-z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9]*)?$`  The Google style guide specifies the same rule for all of these so they should probably use the same regex pattern.  Based on this [answer](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/19021873/upper-and-lower-camel-case) the pattern should be `^[a-z]+[A-Z0-9][a-z0-9]+[A-Za-z0-9]*$`

column3: Sort list of Check/Module properties in alphabetical order in html documentation
column4: The purpose of documentation is for people to read it.  Some checks have many properties, for example [WhitespaceAround](https://checkstyle.org/config_whitespace.html#WhitespaceAround_Properties). It is hard to find the right one when the list is unsorted. The list of properties should be sorted.  Maybe there should be one exception for the `tokens` property - it may be the last one for readability.  @romani @rnveach @strkkk @nmancus1 please share your opinion.

column3: Unresolvable 'new' Indentation Rule conflict introduced in 8.38
column4: The following code snippet exists in my codebase and passes Checkstyle using 8.37 rules.  When run against the 8.38 rules, I get violations due to updated indentation rules in the release: "'operator new' has incorrect indentation level 24, expected level should be one of the following: 28, 32."  ```                 redirectAttributes.addFlashAttribute("globalMessage",                         new GenericResponse(ResponseStatus.ERROR, messages.getMessage("data.trigger.enable.failure",                         new Object[] { ERROR_MSG }))); ```  I changed the indentation level to 28, and got this Checkstyle rule violation: "'new' has incorrect indentation level 28, expected level should be 24." ```                 redirectAttributes.addFlashAttribute("globalMessage",                         new GenericResponse(ResponseStatus.ERROR, messages.getMessage("data.trigger.enable.failure",                             new Object[] { ERROR_MSG }))); ```  I also tried changing the indentation level to 32, and got this Checkstyle rule violation: "'new' has incorrect indentation level 32, expected level should be 24." ```                 redirectAttributes.addFlashAttribute("globalMessage",                         new GenericResponse(ResponseStatus.ERROR, messages.getMessage("data.trigger.enable.failure",                                 new Object[] { ERROR_MSG }))); ```   [checkstyle.xml.zip](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/files/5622635/checkstyle.xml.zip)

column3: Checkstyle's special system properties about localisation does not work
column4: The Checkstyle document says:  > The property `checkstyle.locale.language` specifies the language to use in localising the output messages.  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/6e65ddf942fc95ea47a2cba21b0a98727ea0cb5a/src/xdocs/config_system_properties.xml#L46-L49  https://checkstyle.org/config_system_properties.html#Localisation_Support  So, I try changing the report language, but `checkstyle.locale.language` does not work as I expected. Please check out the following reproduction for details.  ## Reproduction  (I use Docker for a clean environment, but this reproduction should work on non-Docker environments)  ```console $ docker run --rm -it openjdk:15 bash ...  $ curl -LO https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/releases/download/checkstyle-8.38/checkstyle-8.38-all.jar ...  $ curl -LO https://raw.githubusercontent.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/master/src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/MainTest.java ...  $ java -jar checkstyle-8.38-all.jar -c /sun_checks.xml MainTest.java | tail -2 [WARN] /MainTest.java:1537:5: 'method def rcurly' has incorrect indentation level 4, expected level should be 2. [Indentation] Audit done.  $ java -Dcheckstyle.locale.language=ja -jar checkstyle-8.38-all.jar -c /google_checks.xml MainTest.java | tail -2 [WARN] /MainTest.java:1537:5: 'method def rcurly' has incorrect indentation level 4, expected level should be 2. [Indentation] Audit done.  $ java -Duser.language=ja -jar checkstyle-8.38-all.jar -c /sun_checks.xml MainTest.java | tail -2 Checkstyleは 569 個のエラーで終了します。 [ERROR] /MainTest.java:1533:9: 列 9 の '}' はその後にあるマルチブロック文（複数のブロックを含む文: if/else-if/else, do/while, try/catch/finally）と同じ行に書いてください。 [RightCurly] 監査が完了しました。 ```  - ✅ `-Dcheckstyle.locale.language=ja` - ❌ `-Duser.language=ja`  How can I use the system properties for localization: `checkstyle.locale.language` and `checkstyle.locale.country`?

column3: Strange ARRAY_DECLARATOR AST production
column4: The abstract syntax tree formed for type declarations and array initialization looks strange. The following production is to blame:  ```  :    builtInType          (options{greedy=true; }:             ({LA(1) == AT}? annotations             | )                 lb:LBRACK^ {#lb.setType(ARRAY_DECLARATOR);} RBRACK)  ``` We recursively set each new `[` (`ARRAY_DECLARATOR`) as the root node, which results in:  code: ```java static int[][][] method1(Object args) {} ``` before #9922:  ```bash     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [2:18]     |   |   `--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [2:18]     |   |       |--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [2:16]     |   |       |   |--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [2:14]     |   |       |   |   |--LITERAL_INT -> int [2:11]     |   |       |   |   `--RBRACK -> ] [2:15]     |   |       |   `--RBRACK -> ] [2:17]     |   |       `--RBRACK -> ] [2:19]  ``` After https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9922, we have at least extracted the type to be the first child of the `TYPE` AST:  ```bash      |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [2:11]     |   |   |--LITERAL_INT -> int [2:11]     |   |   `--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [2:18]     |   |       |--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [2:16]     |   |       |   |--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [2:14]     |   |       |   |   `--RBRACK -> ] [2:15]     |   |       |   `--RBRACK -> ] [2:17]     |   |       `--RBRACK -> ] [2:19]  ``` But we still should "unroll" the nested `[` and `]`.  I think that the resulting AST should be something like:  ```bash     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [2:11]     |   |   |--LITERAL_INT -> int [2:11]     |   |   |--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [2:14]     |   |   |  `--RBRACK -> ] [2:15]     |   |   |--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [2:16]     |   |   |   `--RBRACK -> ] [2:17]     |   |    `--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [2:18]     |   |       `--RBRACK -> ] [2:19]  ```

column3: AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharactersCheck: False positive on text blocks with a line separation
column4:
Taken from https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9135 ,  ```` $ cat TestClass.java public class TestClass {     void method() {           String allCharactersEscaped = """               μμ""";           String allCharactersEscaped2 = "
μμ";           String allCharactersEscaped3 = """               μμ               μμ               """;           String allCharactersEscaped2 = "
μμ
μμ
";     } }  $ cat TestConfig.xml                            $ java -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c TestConfig.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... [ERROR] TestClass.java:3:44: Unicode escape(s) usage should be avoided. [AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters] [ERROR] TestClass.java:6:45: Unicode escape(s) usage should be avoided. [AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ````  Line 3 and 6 is a false positive and should not report a violation as the leading blank spaces in the text block after the new lines should basically be ignored.

column3: Issue #7663: Update doc for VariableDeclarationUsageDistance
column4: Solves #7663. Update doc for VariableDeclarationUsageDistance. Website after update: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58329164/106312203-52430700-628c-11eb-80c4-35b5c188ac72.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58329164/106312268-68e95e00-628c-11eb-81fc-72f57d2ba73a.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58329164/106312330-7868a700-628c-11eb-8103-dd83e4edcda6.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58329164/106312357-80c0e200-628c-11eb-95e0-a1fc14f2a2e5.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58329164/106312379-88808680-628c-11eb-882c-08ac14a2a5b2.png)  ### Default Config file: ### `$ cat custom_checks.xml` ```xml  		              ```  Source code: `$ cat Test.java` ```java public class Test {      public void foo1() {         int num;        // violation, distance = 4         final int PI;   // OK, final variables not checked         System.out.println("Statement 1");         System.out.println("Statement 2");         System.out.println("Statement 3");         num = 1;         PI = 3.14;     }          public void foo2() {         int a;          // OK, used in different scope         int b = 1;      // OK, used in different scope         int count = 0;  // OK, used in different scope              {             System.out.println("Inside inner scope");             a = 1;             b = 2;             count++;         }     } }  ``` Output: `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c custom_checks.xml Test.java` ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/CheckstyleExperiments/VariableDeclarationUsageDistance/Test.java:4:9: Distance between variable 'num' declaration and its first usage is 4, but allowed 3.  Consider making that variable final if you still need to store its value in advance (before method calls that might have side effects on the original value). [VariableDeclarationUsageDistance] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  ### Config with allowedDistance = 4: ### `$ cat custom_checks.xml` ```xml  		                          ```  Source code: `$ cat Test.java` ```java public class Test {      public void foo1() {         int num;        // OK, distance = 4         final int PI;   // OK, final variables not checked         System.out.println("Statement 1");         System.out.println("Statement 2");         System.out.println("Statement 3");         num = 1;         PI = 3.14;     }          public void foo2() {         int a;          // OK, used in different scope         int b = 1;      // OK, used in different scope         int count = 0;  // OK, used in different scope              {             System.out.println("Inside inner scope");             a = 1;             b = 2;             count++;         }     } }  ``` Output: `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c custom_checks.xml Test.java` ``` Starting audit... column3: Github actions should reuse maven cache
column4: sire generation takes a lot of time, more than 7 minutes most time is spent in download of dependencies  we should reuse dependencies cache  https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/actions/guides/building-and-testing-java-with-maven#caching-dependencies https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/actions/guides/caching-dependencies-to-speed-up-workflows

column3: update SingleLineJavadocCheckTest to use unique Input file in each test method
column4: SingleLineJavadocCheckTest.java file reuse some Input files few time in few different test method. Expected: each test method in Test class use it own Input file and do not share it with any other test method.  more details - https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/wiki/Good-practice-on-how-to-create-Input-files-for-tests

column3: config: upgrade sevntu-checkstyle-check to 8.40
column4: Similar upgrade to sevntu ( https://github.com/sevntu-checkstyle/sevntu.checkstyle/pull/840 )

column3: Replace branch name with commit sha in site generation action
column4: Similar to #9323   From #9930   While generating the site through GitHub actions, branches containing characters like `#` are included in AWS link to the site without any HTML encoding, leading to issue that site is not accessible directly.   Solution: Similar to what done in #9356, we can use commit sha instead of the branch name.

column3: Issue: #9335 Fix Issue links in Google Checks
column4: See issue #9335   This is a pretty straight forward fix. I found it researching the checks in the provided Google Checks document.  The references to issues #258 and #259 were flipped.

column3: Support for Java 15 Strings
column4: Running checkstyle validation on a class that contains Strings:                         """                         {"records":..."}}                         """  fails with: IllegalStateException occurred while parsing file ...  unexpected token: "

column3: update RightCurlyCheckTest to use unique Input file in each test method
column4: RightCurlyCheckTest.java file reuses some Input files few times in few different test method. Expected: each test method in Test class should use its own Input file and do not share it with any other test method.  more details - https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/wiki/Good-practice-on-how-to-create-Input-files-for-tests

column3: Issue #9353: Add Method Name to output for MethodLengthCheck
column4: Resolves: #9353   Modify the MethodLengthCheck class to add the Method Name from the DetailAST IDENT item to the LogMessage. Modify the LogMessage and MethodLengthCheck-related message strings to have a parameter location to hold the Method Name.

column3: Issue #6295: resolve pitest issues for JavadocTagInfo
column4: Resolves few items for #6295  Simply replacing lambda with `Function.identity()` solves mutation problem and make code prettier.

column3: Issue #9967: Travis is failing on xwiki-platform validation
column4: Resolves #9967   PR to fix violation has been merged https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/1622

column3: Issue #9957: Fixing Unnecessary Parentheses false positives
column4: Resolves #9957: UnnecessaryParentheses false positives in 8.42 Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Vyom-Yadav/91807e6244cff60698d9e33e32ba2d51/raw/eb228fa41edadc10eea264a914ea1411f0e52122/projects-to-test-on.properties Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Vyom-Yadav/98dceb63a79f4833e85fff9b2e1464a6/raw/518edf2da1dd8da7ff8f5570c2ebb89671fcfcfb/my_checks.xml

column4: Resolves #9941: Fixing AtclauseOrder falsely ignoring method with annotation Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Vyom-Yadav/91807e6244cff60698d9e33e32ba2d51/raw/eb228fa41edadc10eea264a914ea1411f0e52122/projects-to-test-on.properties Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Vyom-Yadav/98dceb63a79f4833e85fff9b2e1464a6/raw/4e042b7368c2ab4a66635033e0cb338c81f1d7f8/my_checks.xml

column3: Issue #9803: EmptyLineSeparator fix message and documentation
column4: resolves #9803

column3: Issue #9736: update ExecutableStatementCountCheckTest to use unique Input file in each test method
column4: Resolves #9736

column4: Resolves #9719   Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/aryaniiit002/97577199a93846562de23a0d6304e496/raw/eb4a3a70f46a644ce06914ac5ba8fd1b0e3c940b/projects-to-test-on.properties Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/aryaniiit002/74dc91b09b936e8cfdd90de7feaa7e4f/raw/2101e383bb234c9b6410b83af37f40ca0a882dc2/my_check.xml

column3: Issue #9581: updated example of AST for TokenTypes.TEXT_BLOCK_CONTENT
column4: Resolves #9581  ![erfsdfsdf](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73882557/112121054-d0fd5600-8be4-11eb-9595-2a49ed7fc7f8.png)  ``` public class MyClass {     String example = """             Hello, World!             """; } java -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -t Test.java CLASS_DEF -> CLASS_DEF [3:0] |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [3:0] |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [3:0] |--LITERAL_CLASS -> class [3:7] |--IDENT -> MyClass [3:13] `--OBJBLOCK -> OBJBLOCK [3:21]     |--LCURLY -> { [3:21]     |--VARIABLE_DEF -> VARIABLE_DEF [4:4]     |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [4:4]     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [4:4]     |   |   `--IDENT -> String [4:4]     |   |--IDENT -> example [4:11]     |   |--ASSIGN -> = [4:19]     |   |   `--EXPR -> EXPR [4:21]     |   |       `--TEXT_BLOCK_LITERAL_BEGIN -> """ [4:21]     |   |           |--TEXT_BLOCK_CONTENT -> \n            Hello, World!\n             [4:24]     |   |           `--TEXT_BLOCK_LITERAL_END -> """ [6:12]     |   `--SEMI -> ; [6:15]     `--RCURLY -> } [7:0]   ```

column3: Issue #9574: Added example of AST for TokenTypes.STAR_ASSIGN
column4: Resolves #9574   ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52609734/111662429-ea458180-8835-11eb-96bb-1da4a260e00d.png)   ```  >cat Test.java public class Test {     void foo(int a, int b) {       a*=b;     } }  >java -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -t Test.java CLASS_DEF -> CLASS_DEF [1:0] |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [1:0] |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [1:0] |--LITERAL_CLASS -> class [1:7] |--IDENT -> Test [1:13] `--OBJBLOCK -> OBJBLOCK [1:18]     |--LCURLY -> { [1:18]     |--METHOD_DEF -> METHOD_DEF [2:4]     |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [2:4]     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [2:4]     |   |   `--LITERAL_VOID -> void [2:4]     |   |--IDENT -> foo [2:9]     |   |--LPAREN -> ( [2:12]     |   |--PARAMETERS -> PARAMETERS [2:13]     |   |   |--PARAMETER_DEF -> PARAMETER_DEF [2:13]     |   |   |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [2:13]     |   |   |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [2:13]     |   |   |   |   `--LITERAL_INT -> int [2:13]     |   |   |   `--IDENT -> a [2:17]     |   |   |--COMMA -> , [2:18]     |   |   `--PARAMETER_DEF -> PARAMETER_DEF [2:20]     |   |       |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [2:20]     |   |       |--TYPE -> TYPE [2:20]     |   |       |   `--LITERAL_INT -> int [2:20]     |   |       `--IDENT -> b [2:24]     |   |--RPAREN -> ) [2:25]     |   `--SLIST -> { [2:27]     |       |--EXPR -> EXPR [3:7]     |       |   `--STAR_ASSIGN -> *= [3:7]     |       |       |--IDENT -> a [3:6]     |       |       `--IDENT -> b [3:9]     |       |--SEMI -> ; [3:10]     |       `--RCURLY -> } [4:4]     `--RCURLY -> } [5:0] ```

column3: Issue #9357: FinalClass now exempts private-only constructor classes that also have nested subclasses
column4: Resolves #9357: FinalClass now exempts private-only constructor classes that also have nested subclasses Note:- This will still give a violation if used inside the default package. Its fix is simple but writing an input class without package name is not permitted by checkstlye even if you write in the non-compilable resources folder. Code coverage will not be met without that. column3: Issue #7656: Update doc for RequireThis
column4: Resolves #7656  Website after update -  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58329164/107116638-b53f2a00-689a-11eb-803e-b890c22fdddf.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58329164/107116656-c2f4af80-689a-11eb-881c-53c09d521470.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58329164/107116662-cf790800-689a-11eb-9625-f128f7a5916d.png)  ### Default config - ### `$ cat check_config.xml` ```xml                   		                  ```  `$ cat Test.java` ```java public class Test {   private int a;   private int b;   private int c;    public Test(int a) {     // overlapping by constructor argument     this.a = a;       // OK, this keyword used     b = 0;            // OK, no overlap     foo(arg);         // OK, no overlap   }    public void foo(int c) {     // overlapping by method argument     c = c;            // violation, reference to instance variable "c" requires "this"   } } ```  `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c check_config.xml Test.java` ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/Checkstyle Experiments/RequireThis/Test.java:15:5: Reference to instance variable 'c' needs "this.". [RequireThis] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  ### Config to check only fields - ### **(with validateOnlyOverlapping set to false)**  `$ cat check_config.xml` ```xml  		                                ```  `$ cat Test.java` ```java public class Test {   private int a;   private int b;   private int c;    public Test(int a) {     // overlapping by constructor argument     this.a = a;       // OK, this keyword used     b = 0;            // violation, reference to instance variable "b" requires "this"     foo(arg);         // OK, no validation for methods   }    public void foo(int c) {     // overlapping by method argument     c = c;            // violation, reference to instance variable "c" requires "this"   } } ```  `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c check_config.xml Test.java` ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/Checkstyle Experiments/RequireThis/Test.java:9:5: Reference to instance variable 'b' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/Checkstyle Experiments/RequireThis/Test.java:15:5: Reference to instance variable 'c' needs "this.". [RequireThis] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```  ### Config to check only methods - ### **(with validateOnlyOverlapping set to false)**  `$ cat check_config.xml` ```xml  		                                ```  `$ cat Test.java` ```java public class Test {   private int a;   private int b;   private int c;    public Test(int a) {     // overlapping by constructor argument     this.a = a;       // OK, no validation for fields     b = 0;            // OK, no validation for fields     foo(arg);         // violation, method call to "foo" requires "this"   }    public void foo(int c) {     // overlapping by method argument     c = c;            // OK, no validation for fields   } } ```  `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c check_config.xml Test.java` ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/Checkstyle Experiments/RequireThis/Test.java:10:5: Method call to 'foo' needs "this.". [RequireThis] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```

column3: Issue #7635: Update doc for DeclarationOrder
column4: Resolves #7635. Website after update -  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58329164/107004451-4f787280-67b4-11eb-9a18-abf5c5e541a6.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58329164/107004563-7cc52080-67b4-11eb-877b-0809dfb5db56.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58329164/107004502-63bc6f80-67b4-11eb-95e9-73b1ec6cd5cc.png)  ### Default config - ### `$ cat conifg.xml` ```xml  		             ```  `$ cat Test.java` ```java public class Test {    public int a;   protected int b;   public int c;            // violation, variable access definition in wrong order    Test() {     this.a = 0;     this.b = 0;     this.c = 0;     this.name = "";   }    public void foo() {     // This method does nothing   }    Test(int a, int b, int c, String name) {   // violation, constructor definition in wrong order     this.a = a;     this.b = b;     this.c = c;     this.name = name;   }    private String name;     // violation, instance variable declaration in wrong order } ```  `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c config.xml Test.java` ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/Checkstyle Experiments/DeclarationOrder/Test.java:5:3: Variable access definition in wrong order. [DeclarationOrder] [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/Checkstyle Experiments/DeclarationOrder/Test.java:18:3: Constructor definition in wrong order. [DeclarationOrder] [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/Checkstyle Experiments/DeclarationOrder/Test.java:25:3: Instance variable definition in wrong order. [DeclarationOrder] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 3 errors. ```  ### Config which ignores validation of constructors - ### `$ cat conifg.xml` ```xml      ```  `$ cat Test.java` ```java public class Test {    public int a;   protected int b;   public int c;            // violation, variable access definition in wrong order    Test() {     this.a = 0;     this.b = 0;     this.c = 0;     this.name = "";   }    public void foo() {     // This method does nothing   }    Test(int a, int b, int c, String name) {   // OK, validation of constructors ignored     this.a = a;     this.b = b;     this.c = c;     this.name = name;   }    private String name;     // violation, instance variable declaration in wrong order } ```  `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c config.xml Test.java` ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/Checkstyle Experiments/DeclarationOrder/Test.java:5:3: Variable access definition in wrong order. [DeclarationOrder] [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/Checkstyle Experiments/DeclarationOrder/Test.java:25:3: Instance variable definition in wrong order. [DeclarationOrder] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```  ### Config which ignores access modifiers while validating - ### `$ cat config.xml` ```xml      ```  `$ cat Test,java` ```java ublic class Test {    public int a;   protected int b;   public int c;            // OK, access modifiers not considered while validating    Test() {     this.a = 0;     this.b = 0;     this.c = 0;     this.name = "";   }    public void foo() {     // This method does nothing   }    Test(int a, int b, int c, String name) {   // violation, constructor definition in wrong order     this.a = a;     this.b = b;     this.c = c;     this.name = name;   }    private String name;     // violation, instance variable declaration in wrong order } ```  `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c config.xml Test.java` ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/Checkstyle Experiments/DeclarationOrder/Test.java:18:3: Constructor definition in wrong order. [DeclarationOrder] [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/Checkstyle Experiments/DeclarationOrder/Test.java:25:3: Instance variable definition in wrong order. [DeclarationOrder] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```

column3: Improve metadata code and coverage
column4: Relates to #8771  1. Some unnecessary null checks has been removed 2. Added tests for XmlMetaReader 3. Constructor with cause in MetadataGenerationException is removed + suppression added, since this ctor is not used anywhere and there is no need for it. 4. Coverage data is changed, exclude list is changed to have only specific classes instead of whole meta package

column3: minor: test PR for new projects file and removal of jxr
column4: Related to https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/pull/527  No need for review on this PR; I have opened it to check that the removal of the maven jxr plugin from `checkstyle-tester` won't cause any problems with checkstyle CI.  In order to determine where to test the changes in  https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/pull/527, I did: ``` ➜  checkstyle git:(remove-jxr) grep -R 'launch.groovy\|diff.groovy' .github/workflows/diff_report.yml:           groovy diff.groovy -r $REPO -p $REF -pc new_module_config.xml -m single\ .github/workflows/diff_report.yml:           groovy diff.groovy -r $REPO -b $BASE_BRANCH -p $REF -bc diff_config.xml\ .github/workflows/diff_report.yml:           groovy diff.groovy -r $REPO -b $BASE_BRANCH -p $REF -c diff_config.xml\ .ci/no-exception-test.sh:  groovy Note that I have used the github mirror for openjdk(in the projects file) that has failed to run in the past due to the JXR plugin, to show that this mirror will parse now that JXR is removed.  Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/97cf95e0aed0c5789d5e0fc23ef82ff3/raw/1d4d102d59e7cfbc0a4d770fc55de3e04fee3b4d/projects-to-test-on.properties  Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/f5579d1ad36c5ebe441738ad9bf71d4a/raw/74a7356c0a6fc322b11013055046333136f0f3ae/NoWhitespaceBefore.xml

column3: infra: verify behavior of changing mvn arg "failsOnError"
column4: Related to https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9972

column3: infra: move pmd build-tools repo to checkstyle org repo
column4: related to https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/7417

column3: Deprecate DetailAST.branchContains method
column4: Related to https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/5234.  While we are blocked from removal of `DetailAST.branchContains()`until https://github.com/sevntu-checkstyle/sevntu.checkstyle/issues/669, we should deprecate this method in the meantime, so that contributors are not tempted to use it, and so that users know that we will be changing the API in the future.

column3: Add one more closed to do issue pattern and fix violations
column4: Related to #9256   I found one more pattern for to do issues, it is like `till #`  1. This pattern is added to job for checking source code 2. Violations fixed for closed items 3. Second commit - found bug in checkstyle check for checking whitespaces after comments in sh files. Added a new check for it and fixed violations. May be new PR is needed for this change?

column3: Extend closed issues job to check issues in other repos
column4: Related to #9256   1. Job is changed to detect closed issues in other repos as well 2. Violations are fixed (spotbugs and pitest)

column3: Issue #9256: add job for checking mentioned closed todo issues
column4: Related to #9256  Travis failure (without commit with fixes) is because there is unfixed issues, all violations are valid. https://travis-ci.org/github/checkstyle/checkstyle/jobs/758375259  Cleanup of some mentioned issues that have been closed.

column3: infra: disable josm project validation in semaphore ci
column4: related to #9021

column3: minor: add maven flag to omit download progress
column4: Reason: long list of downloads makes in difficult to find useful information, e.g. for sonar: https://app.wercker.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/runs/build/60311065237ec900083b7685?step=60311852476e90000847aad5 and site generation.  `ntp` flag (stands for "no-transfer-progress") suppresses all entries like ``` Downloading from central: ... Downloaded from central: ... ```  May be there are other places where it can be useful?

column3: infra: move config for no-exception execution of javadoc in repo
column4: reason: it is very strange that we keep config for CI of checkstyle in another repo.  file projects-for-circle.properties was added at https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/pull/52 and it is clearly have bad name now as location was changed.  We should keep configs for checkstyle CI in checkstyle repo.

column3: minor: add link to google config to release page
column4: Reason: it is not easy for users to get google config for some checkstyle version. You need to either dig into jar file, or find it in checkstyle repo for particular release.  This enhancement will add Google config link for each release, so users will have a convinient way to get config for specific version.

column3: Migrate shippable CI jobs to other place(s)
column4: Reason - https://blog.shippable.com/the-next-step-in-the-evolution-of-shippable-jfrog-pipelines > The Shippable service will no longer be available as of May 3rd, 2021.  Article suggests JFrog Pipelines as alternative, but it is not clear do they have quota for open source projects or not.

column3: Add jakarta to CustomImportOrder.standardPackageRegExp
column4: Property standardPackageRegExp of check CustomImportOrder has the default value "^(java|javax)\.". I propose changing it to "^(java|javax|jakarta)\." given the move of JEE to Eclipse Foundation and the new package name.

column3: Refactored test with multiple assertions into a parameterized one
column4: Problem: A test method with many individual assertions stops being executed on the first failed assertion, which prevents the remaining ones' execution. In the refactored methods, the difference between the assertions lies in different arguments only.  Solution: Parameterized tests make it possible to run a test multiple times, with different arguments, as individual and independent tests. This way, we were able to make 1 original test become 6 independent ones. In this refactoring, no original assertion parameter was changed.

column3: test inputs should be compilable with javac11
column4: Prerequisite for #9146  Some test inputs are [incompatible](https://cloud.drone.io/checkstyle/checkstyle/1281/4/2) with JDK11.   All usages of `sun.*` packages should be replaced.  InputIllegalIdentifierNameUnderscore.java should be moved to non-compilable folder due to [JEP 302](http://openjdk.java.net/jeps/302)  _Originally posted by @pbludov in https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/9281#issuecomment-781213448_

column3: Stackoverflow error on deeply concatenated strings
column4: Original issue about similar problem https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/8943 Found during https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9264  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/8943#issuecomment-720518021 There is a mention that  > Once this issue is fixed, we can remove the "DeepStringConcat.java" BeforeExecutionExclusionFileFilter module from `openjdk14-excluded.files'.  But in fact after fix this file is still cause stackoverflow if it is removed from BeforeExecutionExclusionFileFilter, see https://checkstyle.semaphoreci.com/jobs/4c552d4b-56e0-4230-81f4-ca696872c9fe

column3: Update verify-no-exception-configs validation
column4: only maintainers can address this issue.   Make validation to use secure variable to avoid security concern. ```     # Ensure that all modules are used in no exception configs     - env:         - DESC="ensure that all modules are used in no exception configs"         - CMD1="export PULL_REQUEST=$TRAVIS_PULL_REQUEST"         - CMD2="./.ci/travis/travis.sh verify-no-exception-configs"         - CMD="$CMD1 && $CMD2" ```

column3: Build also xwiki-rendering and xwiki-platform in the no regression travis job
column4: Only `xwiki-commons` is currently built with each version of Checkstyle to check for regression. Would be nice to also build `xwiki-rendering` and `xwiki-platform` which contain much more code.

column3: update NoWhitespaceAfterCheckTest to use unique input file for each test method
column4: NoWhitespaceAfterCheckTest.java file reuses some Input files few times in few different test method. Expected: each test method in Test class should use its own Input file and do not share it with any other test method.  more details - https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/wiki/Good-practice-on-how-to-create-Input-files-for-tests

column3: Possible Check performance Issue detected in report generation for OpenJDK9
column4: Noticed at: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/actions/runs/698637023 https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/actions/runs/668897720 https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/actions/runs/669273124 ...  ``` Annotations 2 errors make_report The job running on runner GitHub Actions 2 has exceeded the maximum execution time of 360 minutes. make_report The operation was canceled. ```  When Openjdk9 is included in the projects to test on, report generation times out for certain checks.  Checks include: IllegalIdentifierName JavadocMethodCheck  The repository, at https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk-jdk9.git, has not had any changes to the master branch since 12/16/2017.  I think this could also be caused just from the number of violations, since Openjdk's coding conventions seem to deviate from our defaults in many cases, but we should investigate nonetheless.  A PR has been opened to disable this repo in the default report generation config until this is resolved: https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/pull/550

column3: infra: general CI cleanup
column4: Noticed at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9974

column3: Semaphore CI should store build artifacts from all jobs
column4: Noticed at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9922.  Nondex is failing in Semaphore CI: https://checkstyle.semaphoreci.com/jobs/0fe5660a-e294-426d-9b98-da55d26805d7  But not locally:  ```bash [INFO] No Test Failed with this configuration. [INFO] ********* [INFO] Across all seeds: [INFO] Test results can be found at:  [INFO] file:///.../test_results.html [INFO] [NonDex] The id of this run is: EzgD4hKZZGjjmvDFYX+OHf8mnjlmUDb8uKNJTLbZm4= [INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------ [INFO] BUILD SUCCESS [INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------ [INFO] Total time:  13:07 min [INFO] Finished at: 2021-04-23T09:18:30-04:00 [INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------  ```  As we do not store artifacts from Semaphore CI jobs, as we do for pitest, etc,  I cannot access the nondex report.  Information from Semaphore about store artifacts after build: https://docs.semaphoreci.com/essentials/artifacts/  From https://docs.semaphoreci.com/essentials/artifacts/: "Note: Using Artifacts during the beta period is free. Once the artifacts system is in the general availability, additional charges will apply based on usage."  We have free plan for Semaphore, so one day this feature may cease to work, but I think it would be helpful to have while we can use it.

column3: infra: fix branch in no-exception tests

column3: Solve Spotbugs violations reported for Java 11
column4: New SpotBugs [errors](https://dev.azure.com/romanivanovjr/romanivanovjr/_build/results?buildId=1150&view=logs&j=89cf5cab-37fd-5e09-60f8-9a1742bde19b&t=f89aed60-e6d5-5750-95ad-83cc60b84b61&l=10593): `[ERROR] Low: JavadocDetailNodeParser.errorListener not initialized in constructor and dereferenced in com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.JavadocDetailNodeParser.getFirstNonTightHtmlTag(JavadocParser) [com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.JavadocDetailNodeParser] At JavadocDetailNodeParser.java:[line 534] UWF_FIELD_NOT_INITIALIZED_IN_CONSTRUCTOR`  `[ERROR] Low: AbstractCheck$FileContext.fileContents not initialized in constructor and dereferenced in com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractCheck.getLine(int) [com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractCheck] At AbstractCheck.java:[line 294] UWF_FIELD_NOT_INITIALIZED_IN_CONSTRUCTOR`  `[ERROR] Low: AbstractCheck$FileContext.fileContents not initialized in constructor and dereferenced in com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractCheck.getLines() [com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractCheck] At AbstractCheck.java:[line 284] UWF_FIELD_NOT_INITIALIZED_IN_CONSTRUCTOR`  `[ERROR] Low: AbstractFileSetCheck$FileContext.fileContents not initialized in constructor and dereferenced in com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractFileSetCheck.log(int, int, String, Object[]) [com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractFileSetCheck] At AbstractFileSetCheck.java:[line 219] UWF_FIELD_NOT_INITIALIZED_IN_CONSTRUCTOR`  _Originally posted by @pbludov in https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/9281#issuecomment-778971972_  These violations are reported only with  Java11 build. But all of them are the true positives and should be resolved. This is possible a trait/bug in Spotbugs plugin.

column3: update readme.md
column4: learner  # PLEASE READ before removing  Rules: 1) The issue you are trying to fix/resolve has to have the "approved" label. 2) Put in the description of Pull Request the reference to an issue if it exists.    Example: "Issue: #XXXXXX" 3) Commit message should adhere to the following rules:    a) MUST match one of the following patterns:       ^Issue #\\d+: .*$       ^Pull #\\d+: .*$       ^(minor|config|infra|doc|spelling|dependency): .*$    b) MUST contain only one line of text    c) MUST NOT end with a period, space, or tab    d) MUST be less than or equal to 200 characters  To avoid multiple iterations of fixes and CIs failures, please read https://checkstyle.org/contributing.html  ATTENTION: We are not merging Pull Requests that are not passing our CIs, but we will help to resolve issues.  Thanks for reading, remove whole this message and type what you need.

column4: Java16 was released and we have some issues specific to Java16. We need to drop Java15 build and set up Java16 build in CI.

column3: New check: No Else Return
column4: It some cases it would be great to have a feature to restrict usage of `else` scope, if there was a return statement or exception was thrown inside `if` scope.  For example:  ``` /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {     public int divide(int a, int b) {         if (b == 0) {             System.out.println("Division by zero");             return 0;         } else {             System.out.println("Real calculation");             return a / b;         }     } ```  Previous method can be rewritten in the following way:  ``` /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {     public int divide(int a, int b) {         if (b == 0) {             System.out.println("Division by zero");             return 0;         }          System.out.println("Real calculation");         return a / b;     } } ```  Examples from other linters: https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-else-return https://www.samanthaming.com/tidbits/23-no-else-return/

column3: CI Check links step fails
column4: It seems like saxonica updated some url paths of their documentations, so that requests to old url will be automatically redirected to the new one.  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/runs/2345050891?check_suite_focus=true  Here is log from CI: ``` ------------ grep of linkcheck.html--BEGIN https://www.saxonica.com/html/documentation/expressions/: 301 Moved Permanently https://www.saxonica.com/html/documentation/functions/fn/: 301 Moved Permanently https://www.saxonica.com/html/documentation/expressions/: 301 Moved Permanently https://www.saxonica.com/html/documentation/functions/fn/: 301 Moved Permanently ------------ grep of linkcheck.html--END ```  It is needed to update these urls in our codebase

column3: pre-print "Follow Your Nose -Which Code Smells are Worth Chasing?"
column4: It is not a regular feature request but I didn't find a better way to present the following.  In a recent research that my fellows and I conducted, we evaluate which CheckStyle smells removal improve code quality and productivity. See pre-print "[Follow Your Nose -Which Code Smells are Worth Chasing?](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2103.01861.pdf)"  The research found out the NPathComplexity is a smell most likely to be most influential.  In order to validate the results, we are conducting a [follow up experiment](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1y40y7N-3U9G3ke-tUsV1SWaDx5RsXsNhv9br2GWE0rk/edit?usp=sharing) of smell removal. We run CheckStyle on projects, remove the smell and check the influence.  I run CheckStyle on its source code and identified 57 occurrences of the NPathComplexity smell.  I hope that the CheckStyle community will be interested in this experiment and enable us to submit pull requests fixing the smell. We are also interested in getting feedback on the research and our use of the smells.  All suggestions are welcome.  Thanks, Idan [NPathComplexity.txt](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/files/6329836/NPathComplexity.txt)

column3: update ISSUE_TEMPLATE/feature_request.md to make demand to show current  beharior by CLI
column4: It happened several times already that contributors are reading  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/feature_request.md  and create issues with bunch of words on what is problem and what is expected.  BUT all we need is clear example of : 1) how it works now (example by CLI) by template of https://checkstyle.org/report_issue.html#How_to_report_a_bug.3F . Like "A picture is worth a thousand words", in our project **"A CLI ouput is worth a thousand words"**. 2) words on what is desirable with imaginary example on expected by template - https://checkstyle.org/report_issue.html#How_to_request_new_feature_for_existing_functionality.3F 3) any other words on expected behavior

[11:41]     |       |       |                   |   |--IDENT -> it [11:39]     |       |       |                   |   `--IDENT -> next [11:42]     |       |       |                   |--ELIST -> ELIST [11:47]     |       |       |                   `--RPAREN -> ) [11:47]     |       |       |--SEMI -> ; [11:48]     |       |       `--RCURLY -> } [12:8]     |       `--RCURLY -> } [13:4]     `--RCURLY -> } [14:0] ```

column4: Issue #9533: update AtclauseOrderCheckTest to use unique Input file in each test method  Added a few minor commits to update existing input files and removed corresponding suppression (https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9613/commits/a92ea914b23e8825d3aba5c49f03baa6f3e70e2f) and to reformat (fix whitespace) in existing UT properties(https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9613/commits/3ada3145503bee04a4a788e2b85b9643a4b829f6).  Note that warn/violation comments in https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9613/commits/3ada3145503bee04a4a788e2b85b9643a4b829f6 changed location to match the existing UT, as they were not consistent.

These changes are also temporarily in the other PR to show that fixes work and resolve any regression issues when breaking changes are introduced.  In addition `--depth 1` prevent checking out a different branch if an override is needed.

column3: Issue #9173: Checkstyle should support property chaining
column4: Issue #9173: Checkstyle should support property expansion within property definitions (property chaining)  Link to documentation: https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/issue-9173_2021201706/config_system_properties.html

column3: Issue #9170: Checkstyle should support "classpath:" protocol
column4: Issue #9170: Checkstyle should support "classpath:" protocol  The logic in my changes maintain the order of searching for resources; the original PR at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/8789/files forced `getUriByFilename()` to check the classpath first if `classpath:` protocol is specified.  Since I have refactored this method, it will be simple to add this logic in this PR or later if we decide to.  Also, it will now be simple to add support for `file:` protocol, however, `getUrl()` currently supports this.

column4: Issue #9152: Record implementing interfaces, indentation faulty  Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/ca61df3ebd259f03b7a6d4fd866520e1/raw/fca8f93b99256f34d3b12a667b6a3c384e0087fc/projects-to-test-on.properties  Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/ad8818e33f0f1e6f26621b19e411fd31/raw/259d81194cd6a81ca3fbeae7215d93fa4f4fda23/config.xml  Diff report: https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/issue-9152_2021150829/reports/diff/index.html

column3: Issue #9149: workaround for stack overflow in Navigator.next
column4: Issue #9149   No changes in the code. Only test inputs and test environment.  The idea is simple: reduce the stack size for all unit tests to trigger possible stack overflow error on much smaller input files.  As the result, 80% of each `InputXXXXNoStackOverflow.java` can be removed.  Also, explicitly specifying the stack size makes the tests (almost) platform-independent.

column3: Issue #9146: upgrade minimal required jdk version to 11
column4: Issue #9146 Not to merge. This PR is about finding out how ready we are to move to java 11.  When all the issues are resolved, the last PR will have to add a new check to CI to make sure that the code in master can be built with `--source=11`.

column3: Issue #9137: Create MatchXpath instance to forbid usage of 'expected'
column4: Issue #9137: Create MatchXpath instance to forbid usage of 'expected' element in Test annotation  ``` ➜  src cat config.xml                                                                    ➜  src cat XPathExpectedMatcher.java  import org.junit.Test;  public class XPathExpectedMatcher {     @Test(expected = IllegalArgumentException.class) // violation     public void getNameWithNullValue() {         MyObj obj = new MyObj();         obj.setName(null);     } }  class MyObj{     public void setName(String name) {     } }  ➜  src javac -classpath /home/nick/.m2/repository/junit/junit/4.12/junit-4.12.jar XPathExpectedMatcher.java   ➜  src java -jar checkstyle-8.40-SNAPSHOT-all.jar -c config.xml XPathExpectedMatcher.java Starting audit... [ERROR] XPathExpectedMatcher.java:4:11: Avoid using 'expected' in Test annotation. [MatchXpath] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors.  ```

column3: Issue #9133: AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters should support '\s' escape symbol
column4: Issue #9133: AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters should support '\s' escape symbol and Issue #9159  Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/931b74d45ae7ff3b68f379898f9c816e/raw/c8d3c4f19440789c4eaaa17786ebc98d120dd22c/projects-to-test-on.properties  Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/895dff8ab31b89ef9623e98391767441/raw/4a83b19384168311d39053b43a06d640b0cdcd55/config.xml  In an effort to make `TEXT_BLOCK_LITERAL` content match that of an identical (after compilation) `STRING_LITERAL` content, I attempted to do the following: ```         String literal = ast.getText();         if (ast.getType() == TokenTypes.TEXT_BLOCK_CONTENT) {             literal = "\""                  + CheckUtil.stripIndentAndInitialNewLineFromTextBlock(ast.getText())                 + "\"";         }  ``` However, pitest complained that when the `if` statement condition is mutated to `true`, like so: ```         String literal = ast.getText();         if (true) {             literal = "\""                 + CheckUtil.stripIndentAndInitialNewLineFromTextBlock(ast.getText())                 + "\"";         } ``` It made no difference in violations. Instead of making some impossible test, I simply removed the `if` statement and the additional quotes, since they do not matter, based on the following: 1. `CheckUtil.stripIndentAndInitialNewLineFromTextBlock()` has no effect on `STRING_LITERAL` content, since `STRING_LITERAL`s have no preceding whitespace and newline. 2. The additional quotes I was adding made no difference(even when allowIfAllCharactersEscaped = true), since they are escaped anyway.   ~~note: commit https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/commit/9266613df869595a26a10c43d1771c4687d53d5c is not under review in this PR, I have included it because this PR depends on it. We can merge this PR after  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9134 is merged.~~

column3: Issue #9046: use xenial compatible markdownlint
column4: Issue #9046  One of markdownlint dependencies, chef-utils was recently [released](https://rubygems.org/gems/chef-utils) without support for older ruby versions, such as 2.5.3 that installed with ubuntu 16.04 As markdownlint is not dependent on new features from this release, we can continue to use old chef-utils version.

column3: Issue #9037: IndentationCheck throws NPE on line wrapped switch rule
column4: Issue #9037: IndentationCheck throws NPE on line wrapped switch rule  Note that I have removed `TokenTypes.LAMBDA` from `SWITCH_RULE_CHILDREN[]`; there was already a redundancy between `SwitchRuleHandler` and `LambdaHandler`, so I decided to just let `LambdaHandler` do the work.  Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/931b74d45ae7ff3b68f379898f9c816e/raw/c8d3c4f19440789c4eaaa17786ebc98d120dd22c/projects-to-test-on.properties  Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/8277e4d4d979cd9745b86048999a20b5/raw/4064b88513abd5ac7f1af27616af47f168d0d1d4/Indentation.xml

column3: Issue #9021: fix josm validation
column4: Issue #9021  `validation.sh` installs `SNAPSHOT` version of the Checkstyle to the maven cache. But JOSM uses ANT, so it can't find the right jar file. To solve this problem, the `ivysettings.xml` file is patched to use the Checkstyle bundle from the `target` directory.  Before patching: ```xml                                   ``` after patching ```xml                                                         ```  Here we add a new file system resolver, as well as telling ANT to resolve `com.puppycrawl.tools/checkstyle` artifact with this resolver.

column3: Issue #9007: Create jdk15 Input files compilation job in Travis
column4: Issue #9007: Create jdk15 Input files compilation job in Travis  Since Travis is loaded with many jobs, I have decided to use semaphore for this execution.  I wasn't sure if I should make the changes in `InputRequireThisRecordCompactCtors.java` a separate commit or not, since I am using it as proof that this CI execution works as intended.

column3: Issue #9003: nondex tool found issue in token ordering at Indentation
column4: Issue #9003: nondex tool found issue in token ordering at Indentation  This PR hopefully resolves #9003.  I have included the nondex update to verify that using an ordered data structure (LinkedHashSet) vs. a non-ordered structure (HashSet) resolves the issue.  First CI run: failure at https://checkstyle.semaphoreci.com/jobs/d793aa43-1d5e-4058-991f-432f75525a99 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31252532/101262361-24b66300-370c-11eb-8d06-48cdae1ee510.png)  `AllChecksTest.testAllCheckTokensAreReferencedInGoogleConfigFile:394->validateAllCheckTokensAreReferencedInConfigFile:451->validateDefaultTokens:479 All default tokens should be used in config for Indentation`  ` JavadocPropertiesGeneratorTest.testNonExistentArgument:111 Unexpected error log ==> expected:

column3: Issue #8989: Checkstyle parser crashes processing sealed classes or interfaces
column4: Issue #8989: Checkstyle parser crashes processing sealed classes or interfaces  Article about sealed classes and interfaces: https://medium.com/better-programming/java-15-features-sealed-and-hidden-classes-pattern-matching-and-text-blocks-38f4efdc8adc  Relevant grammar: https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/15/docs/specs/sealed-classes-jls.html#jls-8.1.7  It is important to note that while `non-sealed` *is* a keyword, `sealed` and `permits` are restricted identifiers, similar to `var` and `yield`.  I have included `sealed` and `permits` as variable names in the test inputs to show that we will continue to have no issue parsing them.  Since there are no other syntax changes in Java 15, merging this PR will allow us to support up to and including Java 15.   New TokenTypes Javadoc:  https://nmancus1.github.io/site/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html  AST regression report:  https://nmancus1.github.io/diff_guava_ast/index.html column3: Issue #8929: add if to avoid lineWrapIdentation check for switch cases
column4: Issue #8929  The issue happens because the lineWrappingHandler checks the line that starts from "string" and contains the switch statement as describes in Issue 8929. And when the AST go through "switch", it triggers switchRuleHandler and checks each case line base on offset 4 ( offset base on 8 in lineWrappingHandler). So my idea is to avoid both checks in the same case lines. I choose  to avoid the check of lineWrapHandler for switch case and add an if statement to remove corresponding tokenTypes (case and default). But I did not fully pass the test varify,  because the Cyclomatic Complexity is 11 (max allowed is 10) after I add this if statement. This is my first PR. if I miss something, please tell me.

column3: Issue #8651: Checkstyle fails on escape '\s' character
column4: Issue #8651: Checkstyle fails on escape '\s' character This PR fixes #8651; all we needed to do was add the `\s` alternative to the `STD_ESC` lexer rule, so that the `STRING_LITERAL` rule would recognize this escape.  The text blocks grammar already supported `\s`, so no changes were necessary there. I have removed the two `BeforeExecutionExclusionFileFilter` modules specified [here](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/8651#issuecomment-720490304) from ` openjdk14-excluded.files`.  Link to passing CI for the two `BeforeExecutionExclusionFileFilter` modules that have been removed: https://checkstyle.semaphoreci.com/jobs/465adbd8-5https://checkstyle.semaphoreci.com/jobs/465adbd8-57b9-4e87-8fc9-c3c883f2a9ef7b9-4e87-8fc9-c3c883f2a9ef  AST Regression test: https://nmancus1.github.io/diff_escapedS/diff/checkstyle/index.html

column3: Issue #7657: Update doc for ReturnCount
column4: Issue #7657 :Update doc for ReturnCount ![ex1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74173125/105982190-eddc4800-60d1-11eb-89cf-db058d171c91.png) ![ex2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74173125/105982326-17956f00-60d2-11eb-93b3-793d03e03458.png) ![ex3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74173125/105982340-1a905f80-60d2-11eb-96b1-5ebbc3c5d094.png) ![ex4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74173125/105982350-1d8b5000-60d2-11eb-8bb1-38f0dd4c6760.png) Output of the configuration(it doesn't allow more than three return statements per method):  ``` $ type src\com\test\config.xml                                                $ type src\com\test\Test.java  package com.test;  public class Test {     public int test1(int a){         if(a == 0) return 1;         return 0;     }//OK     public int test2(int a){         if(a < 0) return -1;         if(a == 0) return 1;         return 0;     }//OK     public int test3(int a){         if(a < -2) return -2;         if(a == 0) return 0;         if(a > 2) return 2;         return 1;     }//Violation,more than three return statements }  $ java -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c src/com/test/config.xml src/com/test/Test.java Picked up JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS: -Duser.language=en Starting audit... [ERROR] D:\projects\MyClass\src\com\test\Test.java:13:5: Return count is 4 (max allowed for non-void methods/lambdas is 3). [ReturnCount] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` Output of the configuration(it doesn't allow any return statements per void method): ``` $ type src\com\test\config.xml                                                $ type src\com\test\Test.java package com.test;  public class Test {     public void test1(){ } //OK     public void test2(){ return; } //Violation }   $ java -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c src/com/test/config.xml src/com/test/Test.java Picked up JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS: -Duser.language=en Starting audit... [ERROR] D:\projects\MyClass\src\com\test\Test2.java:5:5: Return count is 1 (max allowed for void methods/constructors/lambdas is 0). [ReturnCount] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` Output of the configuration(doesn't allow more than 2 return statements per method and more than 1 return statements per void method): ``` $ type src\com\test\config.xml                                                             $ type src\com\test\Test.java package com.test;  public class Test {     public void test1(){ } //OK     public void test2(){ return; } //OK     public void test3(int a){         if(a == 0) return;         return;     }//Violation,more than 1 return statements     public int test4(int a){         if(a < 0) return 0;         return 1;     }//OK     public int test5(int a){         if(a > 0) return -1;         if(a == 0) return 0;         return 1;     }//Violation,more than 2 return statements }  $ java -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c src/com/test/config.xml src/com/test/Test.java Picked up JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS: -Duser.language=en Starting audit... [ERROR] D:\projects\MyClass\src\com\test\Test.java:6:5: Return count is 2 (max allowed for void methods/constructors/lambdas is 1). [ReturnCount] [ERROR] D:\projects\MyClass\src\com\test\Test.java:14:5: Return count is 3 (max allowed for non-void methods/lambdas is 2). [ReturnCount] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ``` Output of the configuration(it doesn't allow more than three return statements per method for all methods): ``` $type src\com\test\config.xml                                                             $type src\com\test\Test.java package com.test;  public class Test {     public int test1(int a){         if(a < 0) return -1;         if(a == 0) return 0;         return 1;     }//OK     public int test2(int a){         if(a < -2) return -2;         if(a == 0) return 0;         if(a > 2) return 2;         return 1;     }//Violation,don't allow 4 return statements }  $ java -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c src/com/test/config.xml src/com/test/Test.java Picked up JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS: -Duser.language=en Starting audit... [ERROR] D:\projects\MyClass\src\com\test\Test.java:9:5: Return count is 4 (max allowed for non-void methods/lambdas is 3). [ReturnCount] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` Output of configuration( it doesn't allow any return statements in constructors, more than one return statement in all lambda expressions and more than two return statements in methods)  ``` $ type src\com\test\config.xml                                                                                                                                                     $ type src\com\test\Test.java package com.test;  public class Test{     public class test1 {             public test1() {             }     }//OK      public class test2{         public test2(){ return;}     }//Violation,don't allow return statements in constructors      public int test3(int a){         if(a < 0) return 0;         return 1;     }//OK      public int test4(int a){         if(a < 0) return -1;         if(a > 0) return 1;         return 0;     }//Violation      Operation test5  = (int x,int y) -> x + y; //OK     Operation test6 = (int x,int y) -> { return x + y;};//OK     Operation test7 = (int x,int y) -> {         if(x > y) return x - y;         return x + y;     };//Violation,2 return statements in lambda expressions      interface Operation {         int operation(int x, int y);     } }  $ java -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c src/com/test/config.xml src/com/test/Test.java Picked up JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS: -Duser.language=en Starting audit... [ERROR] D:\projects\MyClass\src\com\test\Test.java:18:5: Return count is 3 (max allowed for non-void methods/lambdas is 2). [ReturnCount] [ERROR] D:\projects\MyClass\src\com\test\Test.java:26:37: Return count is 2 (max allowed for non-void methods/lambdas is 1). [ReturnCount] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ``` It seems that this configuration yields unexpected results: Checkstyle ends with only 2 errors,allow the return statements in contructors.I cannot understand what should be the problem here. Sorry for that :-(

column3: Issue #7643: Update doc for IllegalInstantiation
column4: Issue #7643:  I closed the previous PR #9154   Add code example    Output of default example:  ``` $ cat my_checks.xml                           $ cat MyTest.java  public class MyTest {   public class Boolean {     boolean a;      public Boolean (boolean a) { this.a = a; }   }    public void myTest (boolean a, int b) {     Boolean c = new Boolean(a); // OK     java.lang.Boolean d = new java.lang.Boolean(a); // OK      Integer e = new Integer(b); // OK     Integer f = Integer.valueOf(b); // OK   } }  $ java -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c IllegalInstantiation/default_properties/my_checks.xml IllegalInstantiation/default_properties/MyTest.java Starting audit... Audit done. ```    Output of non-default example:  ``` $ cat my_checks.xml                                             $ cat MyTest.java  public class MyTest {   public class Boolean {     boolean a;      public Boolean (boolean a) { this.a = a; }   }    public void myTest (boolean a, int b) {     Boolean c = new Boolean(a); // OK     java.lang.Boolean d = new java.lang.Boolean(a); // violation, instantiation of                                                     // java.lang.Boolean should be avoided      Integer e = new Integer(b); // violation, instantiation of java.lang.Integer                                 // should be avoided     Integer f = Integer.valueOf(b); // OK   } }  $ java -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c IllegalInstantiation/classes_Boolean,Integer,Double/my_checks.xml  IllegalInstantiation/classes_Boolean,Integer,Double/MyTest.java  Starting audit... [ERROR] /Users/himanshurijal/Desktop/CheckStyle/IllegalInstantiation/classes_Boolean,Integer,Double/MyTest.java:10:27: Instantiation of java.lang.Boolean should be avoided. [IllegalInstantiation] [ERROR] /Users/himanshurijal/Desktop/CheckStyle/IllegalInstantiation/classes_Boolean,Integer,Double/MyTest.java:13:17: Instantiation of java.lang.Integer should be avoided. [IllegalInstantiation] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```    Output of non-default example:  ``` $ cat my_checks.xml                                                 $ cat MyTest.java  public class MyTest {   public class Boolean {     boolean a;      public Boolean (boolean a) { this.a = a; }   }    public void myTest (boolean a, int b) {     Boolean c = new Boolean(a); // violation, instantiation of                                 // java.lang.Boolean should be avoided     java.lang.Boolean d = new java.lang.Boolean(a); // violation, instantiation of                                                     // java.lang.Boolean should be avoided      Integer e = new Integer(b); // violation, instantiation of java.lang.Integer                                 // should be avoided     Integer f = Integer.valueOf(b); // OK   } }  $ java -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c IllegalInstantiation/src/tokens/my_checks.xml  IllegalInstantiation/src/tokens/MyTest.java  Starting audit... [ERROR] /Users/himanshurijal/Desktop/CheckStyle/IllegalInstantiation/tokens_null/MyTest.java:9:17: Instantiation of java.lang.Boolean should be avoided. [IllegalInstantiation] [ERROR] /Users/himanshurijal/Desktop/CheckStyle/IllegalInstantiation/tokens_null/MyTest.java:11:27: Instantiation of java.lang.Boolean should be avoided. [IllegalInstantiation] [ERROR] /Users/himanshurijal/Desktop/CheckStyle/IllegalInstantiation/tokens_null/MyTest.java:14:17: Instantiation of java.lang.Integer should be avoided. [IllegalInstantiation] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 3 errors. ```    Output of non-default example:  ``` $ cat my_checks.xml                                    $ cat MyTest.java  public class MyTest {   public void myTest () {     Boolean[] newBoolArray = new Boolean[]{true,true,false}; // OK     Integer[] newIntArray = new Integer[]{1,2,3}; // OK   } }  $ java -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c IllegalInstantiation/array_classes/my_checks.xml  IllegalInstantiation/array_classes/tokens/MyTest.java  Starting audit... Audit done. ```
