column3: Issue #7579: Update doc for AvoidNestedBlocks
column4: Issue #7579: Added code examples for AvoidNestedBlocks Moved the example for allowInSwitchCase property from the Description sub-section to Examples.  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58329164/104704492-bb7c3380-573e-11eb-8a62-d744590d43f0.png)  Output of default config examples:  `$ cat custom_config.xml` ```                   ```  `$ cat Test.java` ``` public void foo() {   int myInteger = 0;   {     myInteger = 2;    //NOT OK, violation : Avoid nested blocks.   }   System.out.println("myInteger = " + myInteger);    switch (a) {     case 1:       {         System.out.println("Case 1");   //NOT OK, violation : Avoid nested blocks.         break;       }     case 2:       System.out.println("Case 2");     //OK       break;   } } ```  `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c custom_config.xml Test.java` ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/CheckstyleExperiments/Test.java:3:3: Avoid nested blocks. [AvoidNestedBlocks] [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/CheckstyleExperiments/Test.java:10:7: Avoid nested blocks. [AvoidNestedBlocks] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```  Output of non-default config examples:  `$ cat custom_config.xml` ```                               ```  `$ cat Test.java` ``` switch (a) {   case 0:     // Never OK, break outside block     {       x = 1;     }     break;   case 1:     // Never OK, statement outside block     System.out.println("Hello");     {       x = 2;       break;     }   case 2:     // OK if allowInSwitchCase is true     {       System.out.println("Hello");       x = 3;       break;     } } ```  `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c custom_config.xml Test.java` ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/CheckstyleExperiments/Test.java:5:5: Avoid nested blocks. [AvoidNestedBlocks] [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/CheckstyleExperiments/Test.java:12:5: Avoid nested blocks. [AvoidNestedBlocks] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```

column3: Issue #5820: fix stack overflow error in ElementNode ctor
column4: Issue #5820  Ctors shouldn't call any methods unless it is completely unavoidable. Especially, methods that may do a lot of (unnecessary) work.  Fields `children` and `attributeNode` now with lazy initialization. Field `text` is removed. It just a call to `TokenUtil.getTokenName(detailAst.getType())` which is `TOKEN_VALUE_TO_NAME[id]`. This is too simple to cache this value.  Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/32ddbff9e69986ac2fcbbeff7def2f80/raw/8480445657f1d215e683dbb6b14c1577bbd44e6b/projects-to-test-on.properties    Commits: * fix stack overflow in ParenPad * fix stack overflow in SingleSpaceSeparator * fix stack overflow error in ElementNode ctor * three minors for AbstractNode, ElementNode and XpathUtil

column3: Issue #4358: add requiredJavadocPhrase to DesignForExtensionCheck
column4: Issue #4358: add requiredJavadocPhrase to DesignForExtensionCheck  I have simplified the logic quite a bit from the previous PR. The responsibility of implementing the `requiredJavadocPhrase` pattern (regex) should be on the user; we should not need to modify the text of the javadoc comment. We are only checking for a match anywhere within the javadoc, not an exact match of the entire contents of the javadoc.  Note that this new property's default value is to match anything; that is, the check will still have the original behavior unless the phrase is changed.  I am making a patch config with the recommended `This implementation`... to make sure this works as intended.  I can run this a few times if we need to.  Link to site: https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/issue-4358-design_2021220527/index.html  Link to exact check documentation:  https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/issue-4358-design_2021220527/config_design.html#DesignForExtension  Diff report 1 (Different patch and base): https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/issue-4358-design_2020075745/reports/diff/index.html  Diff report 2 (same config): https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/issue-4358-design_2020134410/reports/diff/index.html  Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/ac4228829bdf88c2e20aa77f4c358112/raw/91218ae045625ddb04df95cd03077a1402b624c0/projects-to-test-on.properties  Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/121b5d90a82a6fff8831c3842cfd8fed/raw/248c3e4c1d8ae7d9081812a15c0c7921bc417efc/DesignForExtensionBase.xml  ~patch config:~ https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/63a638e7dd6f9c4d3d3ff1006dafe716/raw/70c2b0ef5111ba9de0ec2b619c05171cee59ece7/DesignForExtensionPatch.xml

column3: Issue #4219: UnusedImports doesn't recognize imports shadowed by inner types
column4: Issue #4219  Instead of collecting types into the plain list, collect them for the current frame only. Then remove all locally declared types and pull the rest up to the parent frame. On the top level there will be plain list, but without any locally declared types.  Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/32ddbff9e69986ac2fcbbeff7def2f80/raw/8480445657f1d215e683dbb6b14c1577bbd44e6b/projects-to-test-on.properties  Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/pbludov/25180f2628587d294328749677a73c30/raw/2f786c594fd647f3eb42031eded04f1575a3aafd/unused-imports.xml

column3: Feature: EmptyLineSeparator define how many lines
column4: Instead of, e.g. `allowMultipleEmptyLines=true` I propose that either a new option be added, or we change this to an int, then one could write `allowMultipleEmptyLines=2`

column3: Add job to scan sources for closed issue references
column4: Inspired by https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/5089#issuecomment-774998752 Issue was fixed and closed, but its reference is still in docs.  Possible solution: CI Job that collects all lines in source code (or xml only?) that match pattern `github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/\d{1,5}`, extracts issue id and checks that all collected ids are not closed. Job fails if some of mentioned issues are closed  Note: some files should be excluded, like release notes  P.S. It is also can check if issue is approved or not

column3: infra: move all launch.groovy usages in CI to diff.groovy
column4: infra: move all launch.groovy usages in CI to diff.groovy  Right now this PR is just to test and make sure that all CI works as expected.  See https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/pull/546 for details.

column3: infra: add github action regression report generation section to PR template
column4: infra: add github action regression report generation section to PR template  This will save contributors a few copy/pastes or remembering exact syntax to trigger action, and will allow for simply adding links in the appropriate spot.  I also noticed that we forgot to add the `supplemental` prefix to this template, so I added that in a separate commit.

column3: infra: add checkout_from support to no-exception-test.sh
column4: infra: add checkout_from support to no-exception-test.sh  As mentioned at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9278/files#r576851236, I have separated the addition of the `checkout_from` bash function from the changes at #9278.

column3: New check ternaryReturn
column4: In some cases it would be great to have a feature to restrict usage of If else and use ternary instead   For example:  ``` /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {     public int divide(int a, int b) {         if( condn )               return true;         else               return false;     } } ```  Previous method can be rewritten in the following way:  ``` /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {     public int divide(int a, int b) {         return condn;     } } ``` Example 2: ``` /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {     public int divide(int a, int b) {         if (b == 0) {             return stmtA;         } else {             return stmtB;         }     }  ``` Previous method can be rewritten in the following way:  ``` /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {     public int divide(int a, int b) {        return (b==0) ? stmtA :stmtB;     } } ```

column3: Missed violation for RequireThis check
column4: In reference to #7656, the below code (in example section of Javadoc) does not throw violation when checked by RequireThisCheck. All properties are used with their default values. Documentation : https://checkstyle.org/config_coding.html#RequireThis  `$ cat test.java` ``` 1  public class B { 2    private String field; 3   4    public B(String f) { 5      field = f; 6    } 7   8    public String addSuffixToField(String field) { 9     10    // Overlapping by method argument. 11    return field += "suffix";   // Expected violation: Reference to instance variable "field" needs "this". 12    } 13   } ```  `$ cat custom_config.xml` ```                                                  ```  `$ java -jar checkstyle-8.40-all.jar -c custom_config.xml Test.java` ``` Starting audit... Audit done. ```  Expected violation on line 11: Reference to instance variable "field" needs "this". [RequireThis] Is this as intended? Or a bug?

column3: Sonar Dashboard link doesn't work in Generated Reports
column4: In [Project Report](https://checkstyle.org/project-reports.html) the redirection link to Sonar Dashboard is https://sonarcloud.io/project/index/com.puppycrawl.tools:checkstyle. This link is invalid and should be replaced with https://sonarcloud.io/dashboard?id=org.checkstyle%3Acheckstyle.

column3: Create Unit Test to Check That All Check Documentation Shows Usage of All Properties
column4: Identified at numerous documentation reviews, we need to take steps to ensure that all referenced xdoc properties are exercised in code examples/ configs in check documentation.  This is important for the following reasons: 1. Forces contributor to make and test many configs to become familiar with each Check 2. Verifies assumptions about behavior of check; conversely, this also allows us to find bugs in logic of Checks 3. Helps reviewers to remember to enforce this policy 4. Make sure we varying use cases 5. Encourages explicit and detailed documentation  One possible way to implement this is to search the Check documentation, determine linked properties, then search configs and make sure that each one is matched at least once.

column3: AtclauseOrder: Falsely ignores method with annotation
column4: Identified at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9939  ```` $ cat TestClass.java public class TestClass {     /**      * Test.      *      * @deprecated Test.      * @param type Test.      * @return Test.      */     @Deprecated     public boolean branchContains(int type) { return true; }      /**      * Test.      *      * @deprecated Test.      * @param type Test.      * @return Test.      */     public boolean branchContains2(int type) { return true; } }  $ cat TestConfig.xml                                               $ java -jar checkstyle-8.41.1-all.jar -c TestConfig.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... [ERROR] TestClass.java:16: Block tags have to appear in the order '[@param, @return, @throws, @deprecated]'. [AtclauseOrder] [ERROR] TestClass.java:17: Block tags have to appear in the order '[@param, @return, @throws, @deprecated]'. [AtclauseOrder] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ````  Method without annotation prints 2 violations while one with annotation prints none.  Method annotations should not play into this check's behavior and I expect the same violations between both examples.

column3: Create parser util class that will host util methods for parser that creates AST
column4: identified at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9264#discussion_r572993787  ``` ~/java/github/romani/checkstyle [master|✚ 2]  07:12 $ git diff diff --git a/config/import-control.xml b/config/import-control.xml index 4b52e85..ad4fc49 100644 --- a/config/import-control.xml +++ b/config/import-control.xml @@ -60,9 +60,6 @@           -     -     -                   diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/CommonUtil.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/CommonUtil.java index 9ffb63e..9d7052a 100644 --- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/CommonUtil.java +++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/CommonUtil.java @@ -37,7 +37,6 @@ import java.util.regex.Matcher;  import java.util.regex.Pattern;  import java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException;   -import antlr.Token;  import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.DetailAstImpl;  import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException;  import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.DetailAST;  $ mvn antrun:run@ant-phase-verify ... [INFO] --- maven-antrun-plugin:3.0.0:run (ant-phase-verify) @ checkstyle --- [INFO] Executing tasks [INFO]      [echo] Checkstyle started (checkstyle_checks.xml): 12/02/2021 07:12:19 AM [INFO] [checkstyle] Running Checkstyle  on 1403 files [ERROR] [checkstyle] [ERROR] //src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/CommonUtil.java:40:1:  Disallowed import - antlr.Token. [ImportControlMain] ```  We should allow `Token` only in this very specific Util class, it should not be allowed in other non-parser classes.

column3: Violations from TrailingComment should possible to suppress by xpath by content of comment
column4: Identified at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/8711#issuecomment-731585941  We need to add TokenTypes.COMMENT_CONTENT to  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/41769cee1881c8c92cc59762b90b83529406208a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/utils/XpathUtil.java#L98-L103  and we need to make sure that can address cases from http://roman-ivanov.blogspot.com/2013/10/trailing-comment-check-false-positives.html most of them should be added to Examples to show user that this Check is better to use with bunch of satellite Filters.   > Here I used starts-with only because attribute contained escape character and I couldn't query it. I suppose we need to create a separate issue, if we want to handle COMMENT_CONTENT token type  we need to show users  queries based on `starts-with`

column3: diff report generation should have default projects file
column4: Identified at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/8177#issuecomment-774805912 and lots of other places.  Since we nearly always use all projects for diff report generation, we should create a default behavior for "Github, generate report" so that if no `projects-to-test-on.properties` file is supplied, we use a default one with all projects uncommented.    So that we don't have to maintain a separate file, we could just `sed` the existing one in https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/tree/master/checkstyle-tester, as we do for `no-exception-test.sh`: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/633913daadc885605377e10a34a8923696c2fa8f/.ci/no-exception-test.sh#L18-L19  It would be good to make report generation as simple as possible for contributors.

column3: Extract common bash CI functions into util.sh
column4: Idea came from https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9347  At the moment, each sh file for CI has its own copy of functions, e.g. https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/2275613f2991e6e5df78e629c3ba379c9bcce6e9/.ci/wercker.sh#L21-L23 and https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/2275613f2991e6e5df78e629c3ba379c9bcce6e9/.ci/validation.sh#L4-L6 and others.  So, the idea is to extract such common functions into separate file util.sh and add following line to each sh file that needs common functions `source /path/to/util.sh`  related stackoverflow discussion https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10822790/can-i-call-a-function-of-a-shell-script-from-another-shell-script

column3: Feature Request?: Include Checkstyle Modules from other files
column4: I would like to define one checkstyle definition and use it for multiple projects. That's no problem. In addition I would like to allow defining additional rules per project.  In other words: I'd like to include/import project-specific checks into a checkstyle definition.  Is there an already existing functionality to accomplish that? If not, please handle this as feature request.  **Example Configuration of what I have in mind:** The following global configuration references two additional checkstyle definitions. ```XML  	 		 		 	 	 	 		 			 		 	  ```  The first is just a single module (the XML root) to be included: ```XML  	  ```  The second includes all the children of the XML root element. This is probably the more useful way. ```XML  	 	  ```

column3: Feature: Check Method/Constructor Parameter List Wrapping
column4: I would like to be able to check if the parameter list in methods and constructors is wrapped according to the following rules:  - Either all parameters are on a single line - Or they are broken up into multiple lines, each on an individual line - When parameters are on multiple lines, these lines are aligned  To illustrate this, here are a couple of code examples:  ### Good  ```java void f1(   int p1,   @Ann int p2,   int p3 ) {}  void f2(int p1, int p2, int p3, int p4, int p5, int p6, int p7, int p8, int... p9) {}  void f3(int p1,         @Ann int p2,         int p3) {} ```  ### Bad  ```java void f1(int p1, int p2,         int p3) {}  void f2(int p1,     int p2,     int p3) {} ```  I have created a [proof of concept](https://github.com/zkiss/checkstyle/compare/master...zkiss:params_checks) for this, that allows me to perform this check. I have implemented this using multiple `Checks` that check different aspects of the problem: alignment and parameter numbers per line.  Is this something that would make sense to add? I am not sure I will have time to properly submit a PR for this, but I would be interested in some feedback regarding if this use case is something you would consider to support and if it is worth for me to put more effort in, or if I should just package these checks in an extension jar for my own use.  Thanks, Zoltan

column3: [Question] Is there a way to modify the final report xml/html ?
column4: I want to include few more parameters to the final report XML/HTML, is that possible to do so ?  These additional parameter like `methodLimit` will be set using the config XML and I want that property to be available in the final XML too. I'm aware of the `id` property, but since I've a couple of parameters to output, I was thinking if there is a way to make this work. Should I implement my own AuditListener to achieve this functionality ? I saw that by default DefaultLogger is used, which implements AuditEventDefaultFormatter to write the report.

column3: CheckStyle.xml SingleLineJavadoc does not match the GoogleStyle format plugin in idea.
column4: I use the idea's "Google-Style-Format" plugin-in to format my codes. but the plugin-in formats comments no more then one line as: ``` /** Create a new {@code ConcurrentReferenceHashMap} instance. */   public ConcurrentReferenceHashMap() { ``` However, in ”Check-Style“, if it's a constant or a class, the "Check-Style" wants the comment document to be multi-line. it said likes: "the java-doc comment should be mulit-line. [SingleLineJavadoc]"  In this case , how should I adjust the relevant configuration ? (the idea's "Google-Style-Format" plugin-in no configuration modification is provided).  Thanks a lot.

column3: ModiferOrderCheck should support 'sealed' and 'non-sealed'
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_modifier.html#ModifierOrder I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  Noticed at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9827.  ```bash ➜  src cat config.xml                                          ➜  src cat MyClass.java  public sealed class MyClass permits Circle, Square, Rectangle { }  non-sealed class Circle extends MyClass { }  non-sealed class Rectangle extends MyClass { }  non-sealed class Square extends MyClass { }   ➜  src javac MyClass.java  ➜  src java -jar ~/IdeaProjects/checkstyle/target/checkstyle-8.42-SNAPSHOT-all.jar -c config.xml MyClass.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/nick/Desktop/Tester/src/MyClass.java:3:8: 'sealed' modifier out of order with the JLS suggestions. [ModifierOrder] [ERROR] /home/nick/Desktop/Tester/src/MyClass.java:6:1: 'non-sealed' modifier out of order with the JLS suggestions. [ModifierOrder] [ERROR] /home/nick/Desktop/Tester/src/MyClass.java:9:1: 'non-sealed' modifier out of order with the JLS suggestions. [ModifierOrder] [ERROR] /home/nick/Desktop/Tester/src/MyClass.java:12:1: 'non-sealed' modifier out of order with the JLS suggestions. [ModifierOrder] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 4 errors.   ``` I would expect no violations here.  According to [JLS](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se16/preview/specs/sealed-classes-jls.html#jls-8.1.1) the modifier order should be changed to:  public protected private abstract default static **sealed** **non-sealed** final transient volatile synchronized native strictfp  ModifierOrderCheck should reflect this.

column3: WhitespaceAround on enhanced switch empty block
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_xxxxxx.html#NameOfAffectedCheck I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac YOUR_FILE.java #[[MAKE SURE THERE IS SUCCESSFUL COMPILATION]] ```  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml ```xml                                                                                                                                                                                             ```  /var/tmp $ cat YOUR_FILE.java ```java public class WhitespaceAround {     private void switchTest() {         switch ("foo") {             case "A" -> {}             case "B" -> System.out.println("B");             default -> System.out.println("other");         }     } } ``` /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-X.XX-all.jar -c config.xml YOUR_FILE.java ```bash Starting audit... [ERROR] /private/var/tmp/WhitespaceAround.java:4:25: '{' is not followed by whitespace. [WhitespaceAround] [ERROR] /private/var/tmp/WhitespaceAround.java:4:26: '}' is not preceded with whitespace. [WhitespaceAround] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```  For Windows users, please use `type` instead of `cat` and run  ```cmd set RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" java %RUN_LOCALE% -jar checkstyle-X.XX-all.jar -c config.xml YOUR_FILE.java ```  in place of the last 2 commands above.  --- My expectation was that one of the allowEmpty* properties would stop the violation  on the line  ```java case "A" -> {} ```  ---  Still not clear ??? see example - https://checkstyle.org/report_issue.html#How_to_report_a_bug.3F  ATTENTION: FAILURE TO FOLLOW THE ABOVE TEMPLATE WILL RESULT IN THE ISSUE BEING CLOSED.

column3: Fix the referenced Google Style Guide issues in Google Checkfile
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_xxxxxx.html#NameOfAffectedCheck I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac YOUR_FILE.java #[[MAKE SURE THERE IS SUCCESSFUL COMPILATION]]  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml #[[PLACE YOUR OUTPUT HERE]]  /var/tmp $ cat YOUR_FILE.java #[[PLACE YOU OUTPUT HERE]]  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-X.XX-all.jar -c config.xml YOUR_FILE.java #[[PLACE YOUR OUTPUT HERE]] ```  For Windows users, please use `type` instead of `cat` and run  ```cmd set RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" java %RUN_LOCALE% -jar checkstyle-X.XX-all.jar -c config.xml YOUR_FILE.java ```  in place of the last 2 commands above.  ---  **Describe what you expect in detail.**  For this, the above I felt was unnecessary. This is a reference issue in the provided Google Check file. References to two open Google style guide issues, #258 and #259 are flipped.  If you still find that the above checks are required, please comment.  ---  Still not clear ??? see example - https://checkstyle.org/report_issue.html#How_to_report_a_bug.3F  ATTENTION: FAILURE TO FOLLOW THE ABOVE TEMPLATE WILL RESULT IN THE ISSUE BEING CLOSED.

column3: Java 14 switch statement that assigns to variable confuses checkstyle identation checks
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#Indentation I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac IncidentManager.java # Compilation successful  /var/tmp $    cat checkstyle.xml                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     /var/tmp $    cat IncidentManager.java package checkstyle.bug;  /**  * Boilerplate.  * @author jgrunau  *  */ public class IncidentManager {   /**    * Boilerplate.    * @param userIdentity caller's identity    * @param transition state transition    *    * @return true if user is permitted to make the state transition; otherwise false    */   public boolean setIncidentState(String userIdentity, StateTransition transition) {     var permittedUser = switch (transition) {       case ACKNOWLEDGE, REJECT, RESOLVE, CLOSE -> "Bob".contentEquals(userIdentity);       case WITHDRAW -> "Arthur".contentEquals(userIdentity);     };      if (userIdentity.equals(permittedUser)) {       return true;     } else {       return false;     }   }    public enum StateTransition {     ACKNOWLEDGE,     REJECT,     RESOLVE,     WITHDRAW,     CLOSE   }  }  /var/tmp $   java -jar checkstyle-8.40-all.jar -c checkstyle.xml IncidentManager.java Starting audit... [WARN] /Users/jgrunau/dev/checkstylebug/IncidentManager.java:19:7: 'case' has incorrect indentation level 6, expected level should be 8. [Indentation] [WARN] /Users/jgrunau/dev/checkstylebug/IncidentManager.java:20:7: 'case' has incorrect indentation level 6, expected level should be 8. [Indentation] Audit done. ``` Edited file to change indent of offending lines to 8, and re-ran checkstyle:  ``` /var/tmp $   cat IncidentManager.java package checkstyle.bug;  /**  * Boilerplate.  * @author jgrunau  *  */ public class IncidentManager {   /**    * Boilerplate.    * @param userIdentity caller's identity    * @param transition state transition    *    * @return true if user is permitted to make the state transition; otherwise false    */   public boolean setIncidentState(String userIdentity, StateTransition transition) {     var permittedUser = switch (transition) {         case ACKNOWLEDGE, REJECT, RESOLVE, CLOSE -> "Bob".contentEquals(userIdentity);         case WITHDRAW -> "Arthur".contentEquals(userIdentity);     };      if (userIdentity.equals(permittedUser)) {       return true;     } else {       return false;     }   }    public enum StateTransition {     ACKNOWLEDGE,     REJECT,     RESOLVE,     WITHDRAW,     CLOSE   }  }  /var/tmp $   java -jar checkstyle-8.40-all.jar -c checkstyle.xml IncidentManager.java Starting audit... [WARN] /Users/jgrunau/dev/checkstylebug/IncidentManager.java:19:9: 'case' child has incorrect indentation level 8, expected level should be 6. [Indentation] [WARN] /Users/jgrunau/dev/checkstylebug/IncidentManager.java:20:9: 'case' child has incorrect indentation level 8, expected level should be 6. [Indentation] Audit done. ``` ---  Expected result: audit should be happy with an indentation level of 6. Our checkstyle.xml file specifies an indent of 2 after the switch statement; 6 is the correct indentation based on that. Regardless, the tool should be happy with one OR the other, and should not ask to change to the other and then ask to change back.

column3: Checkstyle 8.41 introduces regression on indentation rules when the line starts with new after try {
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#Indentation I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac CheckstyleBug.java /var/tmp $ cat CheckstyleBug.java public class CheckstyleBug {     public void delete(final int assetId) {         try {             new Object().equals(Integer.valueOf(assetId));         } catch (Exception ignore) {             // Ignore, but log failure to delete views.         }     } }   /var/tmp $ cat checkstyle.xml          .....                                                                                                              ....   /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -c checkstyle.xml CheckstyleBug.java  Starting audit... [WARN] /Users/john.camerin/Projects/accelerator-merge-master/CheckstyleBug.java:4:13: 'new' has incorrect indentation level 12, expected level should be 8. [Indentation] Audit done.  ```  The rule is expecting the 'new' keyword to have the same indentation as the 'try' block within which it is contained.  The try keyword is followed by curly braces, which should apply the basicOffset of 4 and expect the indentation to be 4 spaces more than the try. This should pass the indentation rule as it did in Checkstyle 8.40

column3: Comparison of comment indentation with a wrong line.
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#CommentsIndentation I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  ```bash /var/tmp $ javac Hello.java   /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                       /var/tmp $ cat Hello.java  class Hello {     void foo55() {         /* comment */         new Object()             .toString();             // violation     } }  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-8.42-all.jar -c config.xml Hello.java  Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Hello.java:6:13: Comment has incorrect indentation level 12, expected is 8, indentation should be the same level as line 3. [CommentsIndentation] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors.  ```  ---  **Expected**  ``` /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-8.42-all.jar -c config.xml Hello.java  Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Hello.java:6:13: Comment has incorrect indentation level 12, expected is 8, indentation should be the same level as line 4. [CommentsIndentation] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors.  ```  Checkstyle should compare comment indentation with  line 4 instead of line 3.

column3: MissingJavadocMethod misses inner classes of interfaces
column4: I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_javadoc.html#MissingJavadocMethod I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  bash /var/tmp $ javac YOUR_FILE.java - yes  /var/tmp $ cat config.xml  ```xml                                              ```  /var/tmp $ cat YOUR_FILE.java ```java public interface Iface {     class MyClass {         public void test() {         }     } } ```  /var/tmp $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" /var/tmp $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-X.XX-all.jar -c config.xml YOUR_FILE.java ``` Starting audit... Audit done. ```  When I change file to: ```java public interface Iface {     public class MyClass {         public void test() {         }     } } ```  and run the script again, I get: ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /projects/reproducers/checkstyle/src/main/java/Iface.java:3:9: Missing a Javadoc comment. [MissingJavadocMethod] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  **Describe what you expect in detail.** `public` modifier for inner classes of interfaces is redundant, as they are public by default.  If I remove the modifier, checkstyle does not treat the class as `public` and misses all public methods on it.  Checkstyle: `checkstyle-8.41.1-all.jar` Java:  ``` java version "11.0.9" 2020-10-20 LTS Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 18.9 (build 11.0.9+7-LTS) Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 18.9 (build 11.0.9+7-LTS, mixed mode) ```

column3: Regression report should have option to generate regression against particular checkstyle release
column4: I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words _CLI not needed_  **How it works Now:** The diff regression is always generated against the latest code of master branch.  **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** Whenever we create a new regression report it always get created against  the latest master branch which is fine in most of the cases, but sometimes we require to generate regression against previous releases.  e.g. If we break something with a PR that is merged, if we want to correct those changes in new PR, then there is no sense in generating diff report against the latest master branch, instead what we could have done is like generated a diff against some previous commits or previous releases of checkstyle.  **Describe the solution you'd like** We can modify the cli for generating diff report to take a commit or checkstyle release,  Currently cli is only accepting these arguments:  https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/tree/master/checkstyle-tester#command-line-arguments   Also, If we could have option to generate diff report against the particular checkstyle releases.

column3: Additional "allowTry" option for NeedBraces
column4: I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  **How it works Now:**  ```bash code $ javac TryBlock.java # no errors  code $ cat /sun_checks.xml  # Example uses bundled sun_checks.xml as config  code $ cat YOUR_FILE.java /* *   Copyright (c) 2021 Mike Duigou. Public Domain. No Rights Reserved. */  import java.util.Arrays;  public final class TryBlock {      private TryBlock() {         // no instances     }      /**     *  Demonstrate NeedsBlock issue with try/catch/finally block.     *     *  @param args program arguments     */     public static void main(final String... args) {         if (args.length > 0) try {             System.out.println(Arrays.toString(args));         } catch (Throwable all) {             all.printStackTrace(System.err);         }     } }  code $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US"  code java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-8.40-all.jar -c /sun_checks.xml TryBlock.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/mike/code/TryBlock.java:1: Missing package-info.java file. [JavadocPackage] [ERROR] /home/mike/code/TryBlock.java:19:9: 'if' construct must use '{}'s. [NeedBraces] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```  **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** Checkstyle reports a problem `TryBlock.java:19:9: 'if' construct must use '{}'s. [NeedBraces]` for a try/catch/finally block  which is flagged as requiring surrounding braces. i.e. The rule currently requires that a try block must be inside a block even if it is the only contents of the block. The argument in favour of leniency would be that a try/catch/finally block is a form of block.  **Describe the solution you'd like** Constructs which should be followed by a block would be satisfied by try/catch/finally blocks in addition to basic blocks allowing a layer of braces to be omitted. A new configuration property `allowTry` for module `NeedsBraces` would prevent the NeedsBraces report for try/catch/finally blocks. My personal preference would that the default value for the property be "true" but accept that this might be surprising to some people.  ```      ```

column3: Cannot enforce JavaDoc on interface methods when using minLines for class methods
column4: I have downloaded the latest cli from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  **How it works Now:**  ```bash $ javac Test.java ```  ```xml $ cat config.xml                            ```  ```java $ cat Test.java public abstract class Test {      public static interface Interface {         public void foo(); // Want to enforce here     }      /**      * Do the thing      */     public void foo() { // Want to enforce here         System.err.println(""             + ""             + ""             + "foo");     }      public void bar() { // Don't want to enforce here         System.err.println("bar");     }      public abstract void hip(); // Want to enforce here } ```  ```bash $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ```  **Describe the solution you'd like**  I would like to be able to keep the `minLines` setting but still enforce JavaDoc on interface and abstract method definitions.  I propose adding one or two new config options for `MissingJavadocMethod`: * `ignoreInterfaceMinLines`: Ignore `minLines` when checking interface methods * `ignoreAbstractMinLines`: Ignore `minLines` when checking abstract methods  Both would default to `false` to avoid breaking existing configurations.  ```bash [ERROR] /mnt/c/Users/MWatkins/tmp/checkstyle-issue/Test.java:4:9: Missing a Javadoc comment. [MissingJavadocMethod] [ERROR] /mnt/c/Users/MWatkins/tmp/checkstyle-issue/Test.java:21:5: Missing a Javadoc comment. [MissingJavadocMethod] ```

Generating ./package-summary.html... Generating ./package-tree.html... Generating ./overview-tree.html... Building index for all classes... Generating ./allclasses-index.html... Generating ./allpackages-index.html... Generating ./index-all.html... Generating ./index.html... Generating ./help-doc.html... ```  config.xml ```xml                                              ```  Foo.java ```java /**  * Test  */ public class Foo {      /**      * {@return the foo}      */     public int getFoo() { return 0; } // violation      /**      * Returns the bar      * @return the bar      */     public int getBar() { return 0; }  } ```  ```bash $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar ~/Downloads/checkstyle-9.0-all.jar -c config.xml Foo.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /tmp/Foo.java:9: @return tag should be present and have description. [JavadocMethod] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** Add support for Javadoc inline return tag  **Describe the solution you'd like** Both methods to be treated the same (getFoo and getBar), as it is by the Javadoc  **Additional context** The support for this syntax was added in JDK 16 https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8075778  ``` rivanov@p5510:/var/tmp$ javadoc Foo.java Loading source file Foo.java... Constructing Javadoc information... Standard Doclet version 11 Building tree for all the packages and classes... Generating ./Foo.html... Foo.java:7: error: no tag name after @      * {@return the foo}        ^ Foo.java:9: warning: no @return     public int getFoo() { return 0; } // violation                ^   /var/tmp$ export JAVA_HOME=/opt/jvm/jdk-17.0.1/ /var/tmp$ export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH rivanov@p5510:/var/tmp$ javadoc Foo.java Loading source file Foo.java... Constructing Javadoc information... Building index for all the packages and classes... Standard Doclet version 17.0.1+12-39 Building tree for all the packages and classes... Generating ./Foo.html...  ``` ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/812984/147023606-4df25f74-666d-4c53-933d-fcba6a9d7ff5.png)

column3: wrecker.sh no-error-xxxx requires manual intervention to complete the build.
column4: I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words  Running `./.ci/wercker.sh no-error-pgjdbc` on local after making some changes to checks.  Relevant Output ([whole log](https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Vyom-Yadav/411a2e93c49f9d7ae8411b974031e542/raw/2ff075319a33f77a89010114a049ff6b303e9d46/log2.txt)) ``` * What went wrong: Execution failed for task ':benchmarks:checkstyleJmh'. > Could not resolve all files for configuration ':benchmarks:checkstyle'.    > Could not find com.puppycrawl.tools:checkstyle:8.43-SNAPSHOT.      Searched in the following locations:        - file:/home/vyom/.m2/repository/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/8.43-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml        - file:/home/vyom/.m2/repository/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/8.43-SNAPSHOT/checkstyle-8.43-SNAPSHOT.pom        - https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/8.43-SNAPSHOT/maven-metadata.xml        - https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/8.43-SNAPSHOT/checkstyle-8.43-SNAPSHOT.pom      Required by:          project :benchmarks  ``` However this issue was resolved when I executed the command `mvn -e clean install -Pno-validations`. But imo this should not require manual intervention and should run with just the help of a single command. I don't know much about shell scripting but can't there be a solution like- ``` if(!snapshot_is_present) { RUN: mvn -e clean install -Pno-validations } ``` for every command that uses the snapshot. Also I couldn't find any documentation about it anywhere, please point it out if it exists, if not then this should be documented imo.

column3: AbstractClassName feature add property to ignore annotated with
column4: I generally agree with this rule, but some code generation frameworks use abstracts as a base, e.g. immutables, and then when you use it you just treat it like an actual class.  http://immutables.github.io/immutable.html#value  maybe something like this, where it would be able to check the package of the name, so you could easily include multiple annotations from the same library, or you could include the full generic name.  ```xml            ```

column3: Improve MagicNumber to allow use of named local variables
column4: I feel like I should have an option to allow this with checkstyle   ```java     public CliConfiguration build() {       return new TestCliConfiguration(         this.name,         this.classLoader,         Objects.requireNonNullElse( this.moduleType, "project" ),         Objects.requireNonNullElse( this.language, "java" ),         Objects.requireNonNullElseGet( this.project, () -> {           var numberOfChars = 8;           return RandomStringUtils.randomAlphabetic( numberOfChars );         } )       );     }  ```  ``` +--- com.puppycrawl.tools:checkstyle:{strictly 8.37} -> 8.37 (c) ```

column3: Create MatchXPath instance to forbid usage of "@Issue" annotation
column4: I do not think this(`Issue`) annotation is good: ```     @Issue("https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/8651")  ``` we have git for this, and while we are strict on format for commit messages it is better to keep such information in git (hidden by default). Reader of code should focus on code first, any distractions(extra code lines) should be avoided.  _Originally posted by @romani in https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9134#discussion_r549013953_

column3: Mark sonar violation 'Regular expressions should not overflow the stack' as false positive over AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharactersCheck
column4: https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=org.checkstyle%3Acheckstyle&issues=AXZvXAtca-Kxo9081VHK&open=AXZvXAtca-Kxo9081VHK  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/812984/103140636-c3940680-469d-11eb-82f3-31691c36929c.png)  it is very questionable fix as all other regexp expressions are prone to the same problem, so fixing only one of them will not resolve problem. But we reduce reabability of code for sure, not that much but still. It might be good to keep all regexp in same format to keep code consistent in view.  -----  I marked as "wontfix" similar case https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=org.checkstyle%3Acheckstyle&issues=AXZvXApaa-Kxo9081VHJ&open=AXZvXApaa-Kxo9081VHJ ``` context of this match is always small (names of identifiers or method names or class names). Additional points: - is that such change might change default values of some modules. - we sometime print regexp to user to let him know mismatch,       but not all users aware of "possessive quantifier". So we try to be more user friendly there. ```

column3: Checkstyle failing to parse new escape symbol that was added in jdk15
column4: https://openjdk.java.net/jeps/368  > Second, the new \s escape sequence simply translates to a single space (\u0020). Escape sequences aren't translated until after incident space stripping, so \s can act as fence to prevent the stripping of trailing white space. Using \s at the end of each line in this example guarantees that each line is exactly six characters long: String colors = """     red  \s     green\s     blue \s     """; The \s escape sequence can be used in both text blocks and traditional string literals.  ``` $ java -version openjdk version "15.0.1" 2020-10-20 OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 15.0.1+9-18) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build column3: Remove unused property types from site
column4: https://checkstyle.org/property_types.html#Overview  There is a number of property types which are not used and, very likely, will never be used. - byte - byte[] - char - char[] - short - short[] - float - float[] - long - long[]  Questionable - double is not used, but can be useful in future. Same is for Pattern[]  All properties in code with primitive types have either int, boolean or double[] type. I do not see a reason to keep unused primitive types in docs.

column3: update tables in option page to have link to exact line of table
column4: https://checkstyle.org/property_types.html#LeftCurlyOption  it has bunch of options, sharing a link to table still not precise location target user should read. I want to have a link to `nlow`.  We already practice exact links to table content at https://checkstyle.org/google_style.html it would be awesome to have the same links in page property_types.html for all tables.  NOTE: if we like this .... we might update all tables in Check documentation https://checkstyle.org/config_blocks.html#LeftCurly_Properties to make link to exact property.

column3: IndentationCheck throws NPE on switch expresion with `->` on new line
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#Indentation  ``` $ javac CheckstyleCrasher.java $ cat -p CheckstyleCrasher.java package test;  class CheckstyleCrasher {      enum A {         one     }      enum B {         one     }      private B map(A a) {          return switch (a) {             case one                     -> B.one;         };     }  } $ cat -p config.xml                        $ java -jar checkstyle-8.37-all.jar -c config.xml CheckstyleCrasher.java Starting audit... com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: Exception was thrown while processing CheckstyleCrasher.java 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.processFiles(Checker.java:311) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.process(Checker.java:221) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCheckstyle(Main.java:408) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCli(Main.java:331) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.execute(Main.java:190) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.main(Main.java:125) Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.indentation.AbstractExpressionHandler.getLineStart(AbstractExpressionHandler.java:210) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.indentation.LambdaHandler.getIndentImpl(LambdaHandler.java:84) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.indentation.AbstractExpressionHandler.getIndent(AbstractExpressionHandler.java:84) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.indentation.LambdaHandler.checkIndentation(LambdaHandler.java:112) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.indentation.IndentationCheck.visitToken(IndentationCheck.java:534) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.notifyVisit(TreeWalker.java:340) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.processIter(TreeWalker.java:451) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.walk(TreeWalker.java:278) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.processFiltered(TreeWalker.java:151) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AbstractFileSetCheck.process(AbstractFileSetCheck.java:87) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.processFile(Checker.java:337) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.processFiles(Checker.java:298) 	... 5 more Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  I've also tested with non-default settings. Moving the `->` to the previous line avoid the NPE.

column3: Regression in IndentationCheck 8.40 regarding the white spaces needed in a second line of a try/resource declaration
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#Indentation  $ javac Test.java  successful compilation  $ Test.java  ```java import java.io.*;  class Test {     void test() {         try (InputStreamReader reader =              new InputStreamReader(System.in)) {         // violation                 // try block...             } catch (Exception e) {             // catch block...         }     } } ```  $ config.java  ```xml                       ```  Actual   $ java -jar checkstyle-8.40-all.jar -c config.xml t2.java  ``` [ERROR] /home/abhishhek/playground/Test.java:6:13:    'operator new' has incorrect indentation level 12, expected level should be 16. [Indentation] ```  Expected  No violations  -----  #9071 seems to have caused an unexpected side effect in the default behavior of IndentationCheck.  The following line used to be valid with Checkstyle 8.37: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/xwiki-platform-13.0/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-icon/xwiki-platform-icon-default/src/main/java/org/xwiki/icon/internal/DefaultIconSetManager.java#L129  and is now failing with  > 'new' has incorrect indentation level 16, expected level should be 20.  My configuration is https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/blob/xwiki-commons-13.0/xwiki-commons-tools/xwiki-commons-tool-verification-resources/src/main/resources/checkstyle.xml#L205

column3: Update  Doc of Miscellaneous check CommentsIndentation
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#CommentsIndentation As you can see the examples are added under wrong section it should be under Exaples sections below it.  - update DOC for src/xdocs/config_misc.xml. under commentsIndentation section - update the comments in CommentsIndentationCheck under src/main/java/../checks/indentation/CommentsIndentationCheck file - more details for DOC  please read #7698 and see the latest referenced commit to see where and what was changed. - if xdocs error came then compare the text  of config and src/main/java/../checks/indentation/CommentsIndentationCheck file both should contain same data

column3: False Positive Comments Indentaion method end, multiline comments
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#CommentsIndentation  ```D:\checkstyletest>type config.xml                         ```  ```     // BEGIN: com.azure.ai.formrecognizer.FormRecognizerAsyncClient.beginRecognizeCustomFormsFromUrl#string-string     String formUrl = "{form_url}";     String modelId = "{custom_trained_model_id}";      // if training polling operation completed, retrieve the final result.     formRecognizerAsyncClient.beginRecognizeCustomFormsFromUrl(modelId, formUrl)         // if training polling operation completed, retrieve the final result.         .flatMap(AsyncPollResponse::getFinalResult)         .flatMap(Flux::fromIterable)         .subscribe(recognizedForm -> recognizedForm.getFields()             .forEach((fieldText, formField) -> {                 System.out.printf("Field text: %s%n", fieldText);                 System.out.printf("Field value data text: %s%n", formField.getValueData().getText());                 System.out.printf("Confidence score: %.2f%n", formField.getConfidence());             }));     // END: com.azure.ai.formrecognizer.FormRecognizerAsyncClient.beginRecognizeCustomFormsFromUrl#string-string  [ERROR] C:\~\FormRecognizerAsyncClientJavaDocCodeSnippets.java:89:9: Comment has incorrect indentation level 8, expected is 12, indentation should be the same level as line 80. [CommentsIndentation] [ERROR] C:\~\FormRecognizerAsyncClientJavaDocCodeSnippets.java:115:9: Comment has incorrect indentation level 8, expected is 12, indentation should be the same level as line 106. [CommentsIndentation] ``` Checkstyle reports that the comment ` // END: ..` is at a wrong level of indentation, which it isn't.  **Expected behavior:** comments after method end expected to be indented the same way as other lines before the method start.  **Actual behavior:** Checkstyle reports a warning CommentIndentation about the comment //END.

column3: AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters should support trailing '\' escape symbol
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters  From https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9135#discussion_r550064696:  >The docs says there is one more escape - for a trailing \. Something like \\$.  The above comment is referencing this doc: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se15/html/jls-3.html#jls-3.10.7  _______________________________________________________  ``` ➜  src cat config.xml                                                      ➜  src cat TestClass.java  public class TestClass {     static final String value1 = """         \u03bc\         \s\u03bc\         """; // should be no violation on line 2 }  ➜  src javac TestClass.java   ➜  src java -jar checkstyle-8.39-SNAPSHOT-all.jar -c config.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... [ERROR] src/TestClass.java:2:37: Unicode escape(s) usage should be avoided. [AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors.  ``` AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters should not report a violation in this case, since all characters are escaped in this text block (`value1`).

column3: AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters should support '\s' escape symbol
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters  blocked by https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/9132  ``` $ cat config.xml                                                $ cat Test.java  public class Test {   String value = "\u03bc\t"; // ok   String value = "\u03bc\s"; // ok }  ```  Expected: no violations.

column3: update doc for AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#AvoidEscapedUnicodeCharacters  Add example for each existing config to show what code is ok and what code cause violation. Good example is https://checkstyle.org/config_naming.html#AbstractClassName Please add examples for all properties of Check. Make xdoc to follow structure as we have in other Checks: config is following by code example where trailing comment "// violation" is placed on the same line our CLI will show.   look at referenced commits of #5832, to see what and how should be changed in code.  please play with module/Check by means of https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html to understand how it works.  ------------  PLEASE READ https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/wiki/Good-practice-on-how-to-update-examples

column3: documentation of VariableDeclarationUsageDistance has stange note of default distance
column4: https://checkstyle.org/config_coding.html#VariableDeclarationUsageDistance_Notes  `As distance by default is 1 the ....`  `As the distance is more than the default one, ....`  default `allowedDistance` is `3` https://checkstyle.org/config_coding.html#VariableDeclarationUsageDistance_Properties  it is not clear what doc mean, or it might be outdated.

column3: Misleading example of AST for TokenTypes.CLASS_DEF
column4: Hi, I'm working on adding an example of AST for TokenTypes.ABSTRACT. But I noticed that there may be an issue with the example for TokenTypes.CLASS_DEF.  The example is like the following: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25534730/110816228-276bab80-8259-11eb-866a-71b003baa89d.png)  But I am not sure where does the `+--EXTENDS_CLAUSE` comes from...  ---  When I try the example in the terminal, it gives me t he following:  ```bash >java -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -t MyClass.java CLASS_DEF -> CLASS_DEF [1:0] |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [1:0] |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [1:0] |--LITERAL_CLASS -> class [1:7] |--IDENT -> MyClass [1:13] |--IMPLEMENTS_CLAUSE -> implements [2:0] |   `--IDENT -> Serializable [2:11] `--OBJBLOCK -> OBJBLOCK [3:0]     |--LCURLY -> { [3:0]     `--RCURLY -> } [4:0] ``` MyClass.java file: ``` bash >cat MyClass.java public class MyClass implements Serializable { } ``` --- If this is an issue, then I can quickly fix it. Thanks

column3: Consider upgrading antlr dependency
column4: Hi,  the maven artifact `com.puppycrawl.tools:checkstyle:8.41` depends on `antlr:antlr:2.7.7`, which is from 2007. Could you consider upgrading to a more recent version of antlr (like 4)? Note that checkstyle is already on v4 for `antlr4-runtime`.  Thanks.

column3: Whitespaces at the head of line before a cast and after an instanceof or an "enhanced for" results to "'(' should be on the previous line"error
column4: Hi,  I'm a committer of the [Apache OFBiz project](https://ofbiz.apache.org/). We use a checkstyle configuration corresponding to the OFBiz coding conventions roughly simplified “Sun Coding Standards”  150 characters line length and NewlineAtEndOfFile value="lf_cr_crlf"  Below, first, only the relevant parts are shown (checkstyle and 2 Java classes). Then, for each, the complete source using the "details" tag.   C:\projectsASF\Git\ofbiz-framework>type config\checkstyle\checkstyle.xml  ```                                                                                                                                                                                                                             ```                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  C:\projectsASF\Git\ofbiz-framework>type framework\base\src\main\java\org\apache\ofbiz\base\conversion\NumberConverters.java ```         NumberFormat nf = NumberFormat.getNumberInstance(locale);         if (nf instanceof DecimalFormat) {             ((DecimalFormat) nf).setParseBigDecimal(true);         } } ```  /*******************************************************************************  * Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one  * or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file  * distributed with this work for additional information  * regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file  * to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the  * "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance  * with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at  *  * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0  *  * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,  * software distributed under the License is distributed on an  * "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY  * KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the  * specific language governing permissions and limitations  * under the License.  *******************************************************************************/ package org.apache.ofbiz.base.conversion;  import java.math.BigDecimal; import java.math.BigInteger; import java.text.DecimalFormat; import java.text.NumberFormat; import java.text.ParseException; import java.util.Locale; import java.util.TimeZone;  import org.apache.ofbiz.base.util.StringUtil;  /** Number Converter classes. */ public class NumberConverters implements ConverterLoader {      protected static Number fromString(String str, Locale locale) throws ConversionException {         NumberFormat nf = NumberFormat.getNumberInstance(locale);         if (nf instanceof DecimalFormat) {             ((DecimalFormat) nf).setParseBigDecimal(true);         }         try {             return nf.parse(str);         } catch (ParseException e) {             throw new ConversionException(e);         }     }      public abstract static class AbstractStringToNumberConverter extends AbstractNumberConverter {         public AbstractStringToNumberConverter(Class targetClass) {             super(String.class, targetClass);         }          @Override         public N convert(String obj, Locale locale, TimeZone timeZone) throws ConversionException {             String trimStr = StringUtil.removeSpaces(obj);             if (trimStr.isEmpty()) {                 return null;             }             return convert(fromString(trimStr, locale));         }          protected abstract N convert(Number number) throws ConversionException;     }      public abstract static class AbstractNumberConverter extends AbstractLocalizedConverter {         protected AbstractNumberConverter(Class sourceClass, Class targetClass) {             super(sourceClass, targetClass);         }          @Override         public T convert(S obj, Locale locale, TimeZone timeZone, String formatString) throws ConversionException {             return convert(obj, locale, null);         }     }      public abstract static class AbstractNumberToStringConverter extends AbstractNumberConverter {         public AbstractNumberToStringConverter(Class sourceClass) {             super(sourceClass, String.class);         }          @Override         public String convert(N obj) throws ConversionException {             return obj.toString();         }          @Override         public String convert(N obj, Locale locale, TimeZone timeZone) throws ConversionException {             return format(obj, NumberFormat.getNumberInstance(locale));         }          protected abstract String format(N obj, NumberFormat nf) throws ConversionException;     }      public static class GenericNumberToDouble extends AbstractConverter {         public GenericNumberToDouble(Class sourceClass) {             super(sourceClass, Double.class);         }          @Override         public Double convert(N obj) throws ConversionException {             return obj.doubleValue();         }     }      public static class GenericNumberToFloat extends AbstractConverter {         public GenericNumberToFloat(Class sourceClass) {             super(sourceClass, Float.class);         }          @Override         public Float convert(N obj) throws ConversionException {             return obj.floatValue();         }     }      public static class GenericNumberToInteger extends AbstractConverter {         public GenericNumberToInteger(Class sourceClass) {             super(sourceClass, Integer.class);         }          @Override         public Integer convert(N obj) throws ConversionException {             return obj.intValue();         }     }      public static class GenericNumberToLong extends AbstractConverter {         public GenericNumberToLong(Class sourceClass) {             super(sourceClass, Long.class);         }          @Override         public Long convert(N obj) throws ConversionException {             return obj.longValue();         }     }      public static class GenericNumberToShort extends AbstractConverter {         public GenericNumberToShort(Class sourceClass) {             super(sourceClass, Short.class);         }          @Override         public Short convert(N obj) throws ConversionException {             return obj.shortValue();         }     }      public static class BigDecimalToString extends AbstractNumberToStringConverter {         public BigDecimalToString() {             super(BigDecimal.class);         }          @Override         protected String format(BigDecimal obj, NumberFormat nf) throws ConversionException {             return nf.format(obj.doubleValue());         }     }      public static class DoubleToBigDecimal extends AbstractConverter {         public DoubleToBigDecimal() {             super(Double.class, BigDecimal.class);         }          @Override         public BigDecimal convert(Double obj) throws ConversionException {             return BigDecimal.valueOf(obj);         }     }      public static class BigIntegerToString extends AbstractNumberToStringConverter {         public BigIntegerToString() {             super(BigInteger.class);         }          @Override         protected String format(BigInteger obj, NumberFormat nf) throws ConversionException {             return nf.format(obj.doubleValue());         }     }      public static class IntegerToBigInteger extends AbstractConverter {         public IntegerToBigInteger() {             super(Integer.class, BigInteger.class);         }          @Override         public BigInteger convert(Integer obj) throws ConversionException {             return BigInteger.valueOf(obj.intValue());         }     }      public static class ByteToString extends AbstractNumberToStringConverter {         public ByteToString() {             super(Byte.class);         }          @Override         protected String format(Byte obj, NumberFormat nf) throws ConversionException {             return nf.format(obj.floatValue());         }     }      public static class StringToBigInteger extends AbstractStringToNumberConverter {         public StringToBigInteger() {             super(BigInteger.class);         }          @Override         public BigInteger convert(String obj) throws ConversionException {             return new BigInteger(obj);         }          @Override         protected BigInteger convert(Number number) throws ConversionException {             return BigInteger.valueOf(number.longValue());         }     }      public static class DoubleToString extends AbstractNumberToStringConverter {         public DoubleToString() {             super(Double.class);         }          @Override         protected String format(Double obj, NumberFormat nf) throws ConversionException {             return nf.format(obj.doubleValue());         }     }      public static class FloatToBigDecimal extends AbstractConverter {         public FloatToBigDecimal() {             super(Float.class, BigDecimal.class);         }          @Override         public BigDecimal convert(Float obj) throws ConversionException {             return BigDecimal.valueOf(obj.doubleValue());         }     }      public static class FloatToString extends AbstractNumberToStringConverter {         public FloatToString() {             super(Float.class);         }          @Override         protected String format(Float obj, NumberFormat nf) throws ConversionException {             return nf.format(obj.floatValue());         }     }      public static class IntegerToBigDecimal extends AbstractConverter {         public IntegerToBigDecimal() {             super(Integer.class, BigDecimal.class);         }          @Override         public BigDecimal convert(Integer obj) throws ConversionException {             return BigDecimal.valueOf(obj);         }     }      public static class IntegerToByte extends AbstractConverter {         public IntegerToByte() {             super(Integer.class, Byte.class);         }          @Override         public Byte convert(Integer obj) throws ConversionException {             return obj.byteValue();         }     }      public static class IntegerToString extends AbstractNumberToStringConverter {         public IntegerToString() {             super(Integer.class);         }          @Override         protected String format(Integer obj, NumberFormat nf) throws ConversionException {             return nf.format(obj.intValue());         }     }      public static class LongToBigDecimal extends AbstractConverter {         public LongToBigDecimal() {             super(Long.class, BigDecimal.class);         }          @Override         public BigDecimal convert(Long obj) throws ConversionException {             return BigDecimal.valueOf(obj);         }     }      public static class LongToByte extends AbstractConverter {         public LongToByte() {             super(Long.class, Byte.class);         }          @Override         public Byte convert(Long obj) throws ConversionException {             return obj.byteValue();         }     }      public static class LongToString extends AbstractNumberToStringConverter {         public LongToString() {             super(Long.class);         }          @Override         protected String format(Long obj, NumberFormat nf) throws ConversionException {             return nf.format(obj.longValue());         }     }      public static class ShortToString extends AbstractNumberToStringConverter {         public ShortToString() {             super(Short.class);         }          @Override         protected String format(Short obj, NumberFormat nf) throws ConversionException {             return nf.format(obj.floatValue());         }     }      public static class StringToBigDecimal extends AbstractStringToNumberConverter {         public StringToBigDecimal() {             super(BigDecimal.class);         }          @Override         public BigDecimal convert(String obj) throws ConversionException {             return new BigDecimal(obj);         }          @Override         protected BigDecimal convert(Number number) throws ConversionException {             if (number instanceof BigDecimal) {                 return (BigDecimal) number;             }             return BigDecimal.valueOf(number.doubleValue());         }     }      public static class StringToByte extends AbstractConverter {         public StringToByte() {             super(String.class, Byte.class);         }          @Override         public Byte convert(String obj) throws ConversionException {             return Byte.valueOf(obj);         }     }      public static class StringToDouble extends AbstractStringToNumberConverter {         public StringToDouble() {             super(Double.class);         }          @Override         public Double convert(String obj) throws ConversionException {             return Double.valueOf(obj);         }          @Override         protected Double convert(Number number) throws ConversionException {             return number.doubleValue();         }     }      public static class StringToFloat extends AbstractStringToNumberConverter {         public StringToFloat() {             super(Float.class);         }          @Override         public Float convert(String obj) throws ConversionException {             return Float.valueOf(obj);         }          @Override         protected Float convert(Number number) throws ConversionException {             return number.floatValue();         }     }      public static class StringToInteger extends AbstractStringToNumberConverter {         public StringToInteger() {             super(Integer.class);         }          @Override         public Integer convert(String obj) throws ConversionException {             return Integer.valueOf(obj);         }          @Override         protected Integer convert(Number number) throws ConversionException {             return number.intValue();         }     }      public static class StringToLong extends AbstractStringToNumberConverter {         public StringToLong() {             super(Long.class);         }          @Override         public Long convert(String obj) throws ConversionException {             return Long.valueOf(obj);         }          @Override         protected Long convert(Number number) throws ConversionException {             return number.longValue();         }     }      public static class StringToShort extends AbstractConverter {         public StringToShort() {             super(String.class, Short.class);         }          @Override         public Short convert(String obj) throws ConversionException {             return Short.valueOf(obj);         }     }      @Override     public void loadConverters() {         Converters.loadContainedConverters(NumberConverters.class);          Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToDouble(BigDecimal.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToDouble(BigInteger.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToDouble(Byte.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToDouble(Float.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToDouble(Integer.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToDouble(Long.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToDouble(Short.class));          Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToFloat(BigDecimal.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToFloat(BigInteger.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToFloat(Long.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToFloat(Short.class));          Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToInteger(BigDecimal.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToInteger(BigInteger.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToInteger(Byte.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToInteger(Double.class));          Converters.registerConverter(new GenericSingletonToList(BigDecimal.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericSingletonToList(BigInteger.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericSingletonToList(Byte.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericSingletonToList(Double.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericSingletonToList(Float.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericSingletonToList(Integer.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToLong(BigInteger.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToLong(Byte.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToLong(Double.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToLong(Float.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToLong(Integer.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToLong(Short.class));          Converters.registerConverter(new GenericSingletonToSet(BigDecimal.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericSingletonToSet(BigInteger.class));         Converters.registerConverter(new GenericSingletonToSet(Byte.class));
