        Converters.registerConverter(new GenericNumberToShort(Long.class));     } }   framework/base/src/main/java/org/apache/ofbiz/base/util/SSLUtil.java ```         for (TrustManager mgr : mgrs) {             if (mgr instanceof X509TrustManager) {                 try {                     ((X509TrustManager) mgr).checkClientTrusted(chain, authType);                     return true;                 } catch (CertificateException e) {                     Debug.logError(e, MODULE);                 }             }         } ```  /*******************************************************************************  * Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one  * or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file  * distributed with this work for additional information  * regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file  * to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the  * "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance  * with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at  *  * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0  *  * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,  * software distributed under the License is distributed on an  * "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY  * KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the  * specific language governing permissions and limitations  * under the License.  *******************************************************************************/ package org.apache.ofbiz.base.util;  import java.io.IOException; import java.math.BigInteger; import java.security.GeneralSecurityException; import java.security.KeyStore; import java.security.Principal; import java.security.SecureRandom; import java.security.cert.Certificate; import java.security.cert.CertificateException; import java.security.cert.X509Certificate; import java.util.Arrays; import java.util.LinkedList; import java.util.List; import java.util.Map;  import javax.net.ssl.HostnameVerifier; import javax.net.ssl.KeyManager; import javax.net.ssl.KeyManagerFactory; import javax.net.ssl.SSLContext; import javax.net.ssl.SSLPeerUnverifiedException; import javax.net.ssl.SSLServerSocketFactory; import javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory; import javax.net.ssl.TrustManager; import javax.net.ssl.X509KeyManager; import javax.net.ssl.X509TrustManager;  import org.apache.ofbiz.base.component.ComponentConfig; import org.apache.ofbiz.base.config.GenericConfigException;  /**  * KeyStoreUtil - Utilities for setting up SSL connections with specific client certificates  *  */ public final class SSLUtil {      private static final String MODULE = SSLUtil.class.getName();      private static final int HOSTCERT_NO_CHECK = 0;     private static final int HOSTCERT_MIN_CHECK = 1;     private static final int HOSTCERT_NORMAL_CHECK = 2;      private static boolean loadedProps = false;      private SSLUtil() { }      static {         SSLUtil.loadJsseProperties();     }      private static class TrustAnyManager implements X509TrustManager {          @Override         public void checkClientTrusted(X509Certificate[] certs, String string) throws CertificateException {             Debug.logImportant("Trusting (un-trusted) client certificate chain:", MODULE);             for (X509Certificate cert: certs) {                 Debug.logImportant("---- " + cert.getSubjectX500Principal().getName() + " valid: " + cert.getNotAfter(), MODULE);              }         }          @Override         public void checkServerTrusted(X509Certificate[] certs, String string) throws CertificateException {             Debug.logImportant("Trusting (un-trusted) server certificate chain:", MODULE);             for (X509Certificate cert: certs) {                 Debug.logImportant("---- " + cert.getSubjectX500Principal().getName() + " valid: " + cert.getNotAfter(), MODULE);             }         }          @Override         public X509Certificate[] getAcceptedIssuers() {             return new X509Certificate[0];         }     }       public static int getHostCertNoCheck() {         return HOSTCERT_NO_CHECK;     }      public static int getHostCertMinCheck() {         return HOSTCERT_MIN_CHECK;     }      public static int getHostCertNormalCheck() {         return HOSTCERT_NORMAL_CHECK;     }      public static boolean isClientTrusted(X509Certificate[] chain, String authType) {         TrustManager[] mgrs = new TrustManager[0];         try {             mgrs = SSLUtil.getTrustManagers();         } catch (IOException | GeneralSecurityException | GenericConfigException e) {             Debug.logError(e, MODULE);         }          for (TrustManager mgr : mgrs) {             if (mgr instanceof X509TrustManager) {                 try {                     ((X509TrustManager) mgr).checkClientTrusted(chain, authType);                     return true;                 } catch (CertificateException e) {                     Debug.logError(e, MODULE);                 }             }         }         return false;     }      public static KeyManager[] getKeyManagers(String alias) throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException, GenericConfigException {         List keyMgrs = new LinkedList();         for (ComponentConfig.KeystoreInfo ksi: ComponentConfig.getAllKeystoreInfos()) {             if (ksi.isCertStore()) {                 KeyStore ks = ksi.getKeyStore();                 if (ks != null) {                     List newKeyManagers = Arrays.asList(getKeyManagers(ks, ksi.getPassword(), alias));                     keyMgrs.addAll(newKeyManagers);                     if (Debug.verboseOn()) {                         Debug.logVerbose("Loaded another cert store, adding [" + newKeyManagers.size()                                 + "] KeyManagers for alias [" + alias + "] and keystore: " + ksi.createResourceHandler()                                         .getFullLocation(), MODULE);                     }                 } else {                     throw new IOException("Unable to load keystore: " + ksi.createResourceHandler().getFullLocation());                 }             }         }          return keyMgrs.toArray(new KeyManager[keyMgrs.size()]);     }      public static KeyManager[] getKeyManagers() throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException, GenericConfigException {         return getKeyManagers(null);     }      public static TrustManager[] getTrustManagers() throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException, GenericConfigException {         MultiTrustManager tm = new MultiTrustManager();         tm.add(KeyStoreUtil.getSystemTrustStore());         if (tm.getNumberOfKeyStores() < 1) {             Debug.logWarning("System truststore not found!", MODULE);         }          for (ComponentConfig.KeystoreInfo ksi: ComponentConfig.getAllKeystoreInfos()) {             if (ksi.isTrustStore()) {                 KeyStore ks = ksi.getKeyStore();                 if (ks != null) {                     tm.add(ks);                 } else {                     throw new IOException("Unable to load keystore: " + ksi.createResourceHandler().getFullLocation());                 }             }         }          return new TrustManager[] {tm };     }      public static TrustManager[] getTrustAnyManagers() {         return new TrustManager[] {new TrustAnyManager() };     }      public static KeyManager[] getKeyManagers(KeyStore ks, String password, String alias) throws GeneralSecurityException {         KeyManagerFactory factory = KeyManagerFactory.getInstance("SunX509");         factory.init(ks, password.toCharArray());         KeyManager[] keyManagers = factory.getKeyManagers();         if (alias != null) {             for (int i = 0; i < keyManagers.length; i++) {                 if (keyManagers[i] instanceof X509KeyManager) {                     keyManagers[i] = new AliasKeyManager((X509KeyManager) keyManagers[i], alias);                 }             }         }         return keyManagers;     }      public static TrustManager[] getTrustManagers(KeyStore ks) {         return new TrustManager[] {new MultiTrustManager(ks) };     }      public static SSLSocketFactory getSSLSocketFactory(KeyStore ks, String password, String alias)             throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException, GenericConfigException {         return getSSLContext(ks, password, alias, false).getSocketFactory();     }      public static SSLContext getSSLContext(KeyStore ks, String password, String alias, boolean trustAny)             throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException, GenericConfigException {         KeyManager[] km = SSLUtil.getKeyManagers(ks, password, alias);         TrustManager[] tm;         if (trustAny) {             tm = SSLUtil.getTrustAnyManagers();         } else {             tm = SSLUtil.getTrustManagers();         }          SSLContext context = SSLContext.getInstance("SSL");         context.init(km, tm, new SecureRandom());         return context;     }      public static SSLSocketFactory getSSLSocketFactory(String alias, boolean trustAny)             throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException, GenericConfigException {         return getSSLContext(alias, trustAny).getSocketFactory();     }      public static SSLContext getSSLContext(String alias, boolean trustAny) throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException, GenericConfigException {         KeyManager[] km = SSLUtil.getKeyManagers(alias);         TrustManager[] tm;         if (trustAny) {             tm = SSLUtil.getTrustAnyManagers();         } else {             tm = SSLUtil.getTrustManagers();         }          SSLContext context = SSLContext.getInstance("SSL");         context.init(km, tm, new SecureRandom());         return context;     }      public static SSLSocketFactory getSSLSocketFactory(String alias) throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException, GenericConfigException {         return getSSLSocketFactory(alias, false);     }      public static SSLSocketFactory getSSLSocketFactory() throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException, GenericConfigException {         return getSSLSocketFactory(null);     }      public static SSLServerSocketFactory getSSLServerSocketFactory(KeyStore ks, String password, String alias)             throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException, GenericConfigException {         return getSSLContext(ks, password, alias, false).getServerSocketFactory();     }      public static SSLServerSocketFactory getSSLServerSocketFactory(String alias)             throws IOException, GeneralSecurityException, GenericConfigException {         return getSSLContext(alias, false).getServerSocketFactory();     }      public static HostnameVerifier getHostnameVerifier(int level) {         switch (level) {         case HOSTCERT_MIN_CHECK:             return (hostname, session) -> {                 Certificate[] peerCerts;                 try {                     peerCerts = session.getPeerCertificates();                 } catch (SSLPeerUnverifiedException e) {                     // cert not verified                     Debug.logWarning(e.getMessage(), MODULE);                     return false;                 }                 for (Certificate peerCert : peerCerts) {                     try {                         Principal x500s = session.getPeerPrincipal();                         Map subjectMap = KeyStoreUtil.getX500Map(x500s);                         if (Debug.infoOn()) {                             byte[] encodedCert = peerCert.getEncoded();                             Debug.logInfo(new BigInteger(encodedCert).toString(16)                                     + " :: " + subjectMap.get("CN"), MODULE);                         }                         peerCert.verify(peerCert.getPublicKey());                     } catch (RuntimeException e) {                         throw e;                     } catch (Exception e) {                         // certificate not valid                         Debug.logWarning("Certificate is not valid!", MODULE);                         return false;                     }                 }                 return true;             };         case HOSTCERT_NO_CHECK:             return (hostname, session) -> true;         default:             return null;         }     }      public static void loadJsseProperties() {         loadJsseProperties(false);     }      public static synchronized void loadJsseProperties(boolean debug) {         if (!loadedProps) {             String protocol = UtilProperties.getPropertyValue("jsse", "java.protocol.handler.pkgs", "NONE");             String proxyHost = UtilProperties.getPropertyValue("jsse", "https.proxyHost", "NONE");             String proxyPort = UtilProperties.getPropertyValue("jsse", "https.proxyPort", "NONE");             String cypher = UtilProperties.getPropertyValue("jsse", "https.cipherSuites", "NONE");             if (protocol != null && !"NONE".equals(protocol)) {                 System.setProperty("java.protocol.handler.pkgs", protocol);             }             if (proxyHost != null && !"NONE".equals(proxyHost)) {                 System.setProperty("https.proxyHost", proxyHost);             }             if (proxyPort != null && !"NONE".equals(proxyPort)) {                 System.setProperty("https.proxyPort", proxyPort);             }             if (cypher != null && !"NONE".equals(cypher)) {                 System.setProperty("https.cipherSuites", cypher);             }              if (debug) {                 System.setProperty("javax.net.debug", "ssl:handshake");             }             loadedProps = true;         }     } }   ``` C:\projectsASF\Git\ofbiz-framework>java -Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US -jar checkstyle-8.42-all.jar -c config\checkstyle\checkstyle.xml framework\base\src\main\java\org\apache\ofbiz\base\conversion\NumberConverters.java Starting audit... [ERROR] C:\projectsASF\Git\ofbiz-framework\framework\base\src\main\java\org\apache\ofbiz\base\conversion\NumberConverters.java:37:13: '(' should be on the previous line. [SeparatorWrap] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ``` I have been working on MethodParamPad[0]. I could fix few issues but despite my efforts[1][2], as you can see [here](https://ci.apache.org/projects/ofbiz/logs/trunk/checkstyle.html) we have still 22 issues of "'(' should be on the previous line." in Java source code.  Among them there are some cases that can't be handled by changing code, notably when a casting is necessary. Using instanceof  or "enhanced for" are typical cases. Of course we could add an initial line to assign the cast to another var before the real expression is used. But it's a tedious work and I'd prefer if we could anticipate (we still recommend JDK 8 but already support JDK 11) something like what JDK 14 provides (I know you also rely on JDK 8 for now). I mean :  ``` for (any instanceof String s) {   System.out.println(s); } ```  Looking at MethodParamPad[0], how could we allow white-spaces at head of the line after instanceof or "enhanced for", do I miss something or is this a real bug?   Note: we don't want to use  ```        ``` Because we want to check the other cases, as the ones I fixed.  TIA  Jacques  [0]  https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_whitespace.html#MethodParamPad [1] https://github.com/apache/ofbiz-framework/commit/45f50c910d64c12a2601164fbc64a4a02ef1d833/ [2] https://github.com/apache/ofbiz-plugins/commit/dbfa4f0ca0620896a2313d5b784d197bbc25d4d3/

column3: Share checkstyle.xml config between multiple projects
column4: Hi team,  I would like to use a single checksty.xml for multiple projects.  Are there any best practices for this?  How to share config between multiple maven projects?

column3: Record implementing interfaces, indentation faulty
column4: Hi again, it's me. I've found another caveat with the addition of java records and checkstyle. I wonder if this is a bug, or what's causing it?  `$ cat rules.xml`  ```xml                                                                                                               ```   `$ cat Example.java`  ```java class Example {     private interface Interf {         String sayHello();     }      private static record ConcreteRecord(         String greeting     ) implements Interf {         @Override         public String sayHello() {             return greeting();         }     }      private static void otherMethod() {         String str = "Some str";         if ((str != null && str.trim() != null)             || str.equals("Hello")             || str.equals("Hi")         ) {             System.out.println("Hello there!");         }     } } ```   `$ java -Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c rules.xml Example.java`  ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] Example.java:8:7: 'implements' has incorrect indentation level 6, expected level should be 8. [Indentation] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  If I change the property `lineWrappingIndentation` to `0`, it works (but i guess the entire check is disabled then) I wouldn't treat record declarations as line-wrapping code.  I have quite a few records, with more than one argument/property, and I usually space them out on separate lines. Any idea if this is a bug, or intended?  Ping @nmancus1 maybe? 🙏

column3: Bug report about: Indentation -> arrayInitIndent
column4: Hello.  I have a strange behaviour of checkstyle when I have the following rules: ``` C:\checkstyle>javac -cp ^   "C:\Users\Roman_Karpenko\.m2\repository\org\onehippo\cms7\hippo-cms7-commons\14.3.3\hippo-cms7-commons-14.3.3.jar" ^    AccordionContentComponentInfo.java  C:\checkstyle>cat checkstyle.xml                                                                                   C:\checkstyle>cat AccordionContentComponentInfo.java package checkstyle;  import org.hippoecm.hst.core.parameters.FieldGroup; import org.hippoecm.hst.core.parameters.FieldGroupList;  @FieldGroupList({     @FieldGroup(         value = {"", "document", ""},         titleKey = "accordioncontent.main.group"     ) // violation }) public interface AccordionContentComponentInfo {  }  C:\checkstyle>set RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US"  C:\checkstyle>java %RUN_LOCALE% -jar checkstyle-8.40-all.jar -c checkstyle.xml ^       AccordionContentComponentInfo.java Starting audit... [WARN] C:\checkstyle\AccordionContentComponentInfo.java:10:5:     'annotation array initialization' child has incorrect indentation level 4,      expected level should be 8. [Indentation] Audit done. ``` It looks like bug to me because it reports to totally wrong line where I have right parenthesis. What I expect: no warnings.  ---   If I change my code to  ``` @FieldGroupList({     @FieldGroup(         value = {"", "document", ""},         titleKey = "accordioncontent.main.group") }) ``` I don't get any warnings.

column3: JavadocMethod to allow empty @return tags
column4: Hello,  at the moment, I am not able to configure the JavadocMethod check to allow empty @return tags. My setup:  ``` /var/tmp $ cat config.xml                                                          /var/tmp $ javac Test.java  /var/tmp $ cat Test.java public class Test {  	/** 	 * Returns the sum of the two numbers, {@code a} and {@code b}. 	 *  	 * @param a first summand 	 * @param b 	 * @return 	 */ 	public int sum(int a, int b) { 		return a + b; 	} 	 	/** 	 * Returns the product of two numbers, {@code a} and {@code b}. 	 *  	 * @param a first multiplicand 	 * @param b 	 * @return product of {@code a} and {@code b} 	 */ 	public int prod(int a, int b) { 		return a * b; 	}  } ``` Running the checkstyle produces: ``` [WARN] 12: @return tag should be present and have description. [JavadocMethod] ``` While it seems that empty @param tags do not cause any issues, empty @return tags do. Is there a way to configure checkstyle so that empty @return tags are considered valid? I tried using `SuppressionSingleFilter` and filter by message, but the problem with this approach is that missing return tag and empty return tag produce the same message, and I only want to report missing return tags.  If this is not possible, would you consider adding this feature?

column3: Feature: EmptyLineSeparator disallow empty lines at beginning and end of methods
column4: given this config ```xml                         ``` when you have this, the check would fail ```java class Foo {    public void foo() {       System.out.println(1); // violation since method has 1 or more empty lines subsequently at the beginning of the method   } } ``` but this would succeed ```java class Foo {    public void foo() {     System.out.println(2);      System.out.println(1); }

column3: Issue #9580: update example of AST for TokenTypes.SWITCH_RULE
column4: Generated javadoc: ![javadoc-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76477007/112207386-f30bce00-8c0e-11eb-8efd-0de92a0a442f.png) ![javadoc-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76477007/112207394-f606be80-8c0e-11eb-8ae3-e14de9c5745d.png)  Code example: ``` $ javac ~/Test.java $ cat ~/Test.java public class Test {    public static String test(Day day) {     return switch (day) {       case SAT, SUN -> "Weekend";       default -> "Working day";     };   }      enum Day {     SAT,     SUN,     OTHER   }  } ```  Relevant AST: ```     |       |--LITERAL_RETURN -> return [4:4]     |       |   |--EXPR -> EXPR [4:11]     |       |   |   `--LITERAL_SWITCH -> switch [4:11]     |       |   |       |--LPAREN -> ( [4:18]     |       |   |       |--EXPR -> EXPR [4:19]     |       |   |       |   `--IDENT -> day [4:19]     |       |   |       |--RPAREN -> ) [4:22]     |       |   |       |--LCURLY -> { [4:24] column3: Rename references of Messages to Violation
column4: From: #9761   In #9761, LocalizedMessage was renamed to Violation. A lot of API changes were made, but still, a lot of them still remain to be renamed to new reference to give clear context.  Eg: [getMessages -> getViolations](https://github.com/AkMo3/checkstyle/blob/25796f93a48eba65d7758374b6c052f946bff207/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/AuditEvent.java#L108) , [fileMessages -> fileViolations](https://github.com/AkMo3/checkstyle/blob/0e323971313327d82d4908d2bdebc40cd13d5fcf/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Checker.java#L289), [message -> violation](https://github.com/AkMo3/checkstyle/blob/0e323971313327d82d4908d2bdebc40cd13d5fcf/src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/AbstractModuleTestSupport.java#L346)  Similar changes are needed to made in Javadoc of these new changed methods are methods are using them.

column3: Check RegexpMultipline is not following/searching regex when the lines are spread in multi-line
column4: From the check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_regexp.html#RegexpMultiline  $ javac Test.java `successful compilation`  $ cat Test.java ```java class T { // line 1   void method() {     //line:2   System.out.print("Example");    //line:3   System.err.println("Example");    //line:4   System.out.print    //line:5     ("Example");    //line:6   System.err.println    //line:7   ("Example");    //line:8   System    //line:9   .err.print("Example");    //line:10   System    //line:11   .err.println("Example");    //line:12   System.   //line:13   out.print("Example");   //line:14   System.   //line:15   err.println("Example");   //line:16   }    //17 } //18 ``` $ cat config.xml ```xml                        ```  # Actual $ java -jar checkstyle-8.39-SNAPSHOT-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java  ```bash Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/abhishhek/playground/Test.java:3: Line matches the illegal pattern 'System\.(out)|(err)\.print(ln)?\('. [RegexpMultiline] [ERROR] /home/abhishhek/playground/Test.java:4: Line matches the illegal pattern 'System\.(out)|(err)\.print(ln)?\('. [RegexpMultiline] [ERROR] /home/abhishhek/playground/Test.java:5: Line matches the illegal pattern 'System\.(out)|(err)\.print(ln)?\('. [RegexpMultiline] [ERROR] /home/abhishhek/playground/Test.java:10: Line matches the illegal pattern 'System\.(out)|(err)\.print(ln)?\('. [RegexpMultiline] [ERROR] /home/abhishhek/playground/Test.java:12: Line matches the illegal pattern 'System\.(out)|(err)\.print(ln)?\('. [RegexpMultiline] [ERROR] /home/abhishhek/playground/Test.java:16: Line matches the illegal pattern 'System\.(out)|(err)\.print(ln)?\('. [RegexpMultiline] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 6 errors. ```  # Expected  What I got from the documentation that it matches all the lines to check against the regex (whether on single and multi-line) and log it to the user. This way every expression in the code sample should be matched to the regex and thus should raise violation to show that they have got the regex in the file.  **Expected behaviour should be like the checkstyle should raise violation for all the expressions, Line 7 and 14 should also raise violations since they too are matching the regex**  Also if line 3 is giving error then line 13 or 14 should also raise the error, since they are same just spread in multi-line in later case and `RegexpMultiline` should catch it.  Part 2: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/9172

column3: "Good practice on how to create Input files for tests" Wiki should be updated with new check input file config policy
column4: From https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9613#discussion_r595455931:  >It would be better if the file starts with configuration. Like in all the input test cases of indentationCheckTest, we are enforcing configs to be placed at the top of the file, so we can follow the same here to be more consistent.  _Originally posted by @Abhishek-kumar09 in https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9613#discussion_r595455931_   Current wiki example shows check `/* Config` comments should be placed immediately above the top-level class in each input file: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/wiki/Good-practice-on-how-to-create-Input-files-for-tests.  We should update the wiki so that contributors adhere to this policy, if this is the case.  Files that use this policy: ```bash  ➜  checkstyle git:(issue-9533) head -n1 **/test/**/indentation/*.java | grep "Config" -B1 | grep ".java" ==> column3: ImportOrder and CustomImportOrder report only first "Extra separation" violation, inconsistent order
column4: from https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9225#issuecomment-770578744  This is well known problem. Both `ImportOrder` and `CustomImportOrder` checks report "Extra separation" violation. But only first message will be logged. Which one will be first depends on the phase of the moon. This behaviuor can be changed [here](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/1e3fb3fae940bf7ea340592f7f0cda3af1b320e3/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/TreeWalker.java#L55) by replacing `HashMap` with any ordered map. But there may be some nuances related to threading in the future. Another way is to report "Extra separation" violation twice.  Expected: order of violations should be deterministic

column3: SummaryJavadocCheck: remove special internal method getFirstSentence
column4: from https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9174/files#r612396057  it is not clear why we need two methods `getFirstSentence` and `getSummarySentence`.  Ideally we should have only one method like getSummarySentence that return summary sentence if it present. Non of this method do this job, we need combine them in single method. All Check validation should done on single string value.   https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s7.2-summary-fragment  > 7.2 The summary fragment Each Javadoc block begins with a brief summary fragment. This fragment is very important: it is the only part of the text that appears in certain contexts such as class and method indexes.  such indexes are html areas with summary content, so if text is not rendered, it is not visible to user. Decision on violation should be simple. If content is visible in HTML summary table - no violation, if not visible - violation.  > `/**  */`  will not be visible in html summary table, so violation should be on it.  > `/**  */`  will aslo be rendered as no summary in HTML, so violation should be.  -----  There is another point is "what content validate by regexp as forbidden content? only visible or raw content of javadoc comment?"  I think better to validate raw content of javadoc comment to let user have more control over content of javadoc.

column3: Record definition elements "record component list" and "implements clause" out of order in AST
column4: From https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9157#issue-550110578 and https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/9152#issuecomment-755031970:  I have discovered an issue with the construction of the record definition AST, which affects the functionality of IndentationCheck on records that implement an interface: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/7e76db268f109f658220dc68eaa2dadc31b2dd5f/src/main/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/grammar/java.g#L562-L570  The `recordComponentsList` and `implementsClause` ASTs order is reversed in the tree construction on line 569.   We need to resolve this issue before we can merge the changes at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9157.

column3: JavadocMetadataScraper should narrow token parsing to exact list
column4:
from https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9153#issuecomment-766023112  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/1e3fb3fae940bf7ea340592f7f0cda3af1b320e3/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/meta/JavadocMetadataScraper.java#L325 `initialText` is receiving more than just the tokens. It is receiving the entire Javadoc line including other things besides the token. > `Default value is:
 
 LITERAL_TRY,
 
 LITERAL_CATCH,
 
 LITERAL_FINALLY,
 
 LITERAL_IF,
 
 LITERAL_ELSE.
   The fact that we are parsing an entire javadoc text and we don't know where our tokens are seems like a concern for me since this leaves us to the possibility that we can match any uppercase letters by mistake just because someone wrote something like that into the javadoc. This explains a simple regexp change to fail like this. The way things are coded right now we could accidentally match any consecutive uppercase letters, the most common example is any acronym like JRE and JDK.  This code should be looked into and possibly redone. Blind text parsing like this shows inexperience and will only lead us to more troubles in the future, IMO.  Because of the usage of this matcher also in https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/1e3fb3fae940bf7ea340592f7f0cda3af1b320e3/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/meta/JavadocMetadataScraper.java#L356 , it may not end up being a simple fix as this 2nd area goes against the AST text while the other area goes against the raw text. If set incorrectly, we will be matching on text like `LI` from the LI html tag which has brackets surrounding it but we don't see the brackets because the text we are examining is all structured from the tree.  So we are trying to use the same matcher between RAW full text and Structured, partial text. This code is all so bizarre and severely error prone.

column3: JavadocTagContinuationIndentation does not check text inside HTML elements
column4: From https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/8177#discussion_r579386002  Check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_javadoc.html#JavadocTagContinuationIndentation  ```cmd D:\checkstyletest>type config.xml                                         D:\checkstyletest>type test\MyClass.java class MyClass {      /**      * Javadoc.      *      * @param x This is the start of a param tag.      *     Continuing lines must have indentation. // ok      * Lines without indentation are violations. // violation      * HTML tags are also affected by this rule. // not a violation yet, will be fixed in #8177      * And subsequent text is also checked. // violation      *           * However, text nested inside HTML elements are unaffected. // no violation      *           */     void foo(int x) {         // do stuff     }  } D:\checkstyletest>set RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US"  D:\checkstyletest>java -jar "-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" checkstyle-8.40-all.jar -c config.xml test\MyClass.java Starting audit... [ERROR] D:\checkstyletest\test\MyClass.java:8: Line continuation have incorrect indentation level, expected level should be 4. [JavadocTagContinuationIndentation] [ERROR] D:\checkstyletest\test\MyClass.java:10: Line continuation have incorrect indentation level, expected level should be 4. [JavadocTagContinuationIndentation] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```  ---  The line `However, text nested inside HTML elements are unaffected.` does not raise any violation, despite having no indentation with respect to the `@param` tag. In general, when HTML elements are involved the text between the start and end tags is not checked.  This behavior may be unintuitive as the check documentation does not have any examples on whether or not this is considered a violation. - ~~If this is intended behavior, then the documentation should be updated to include a similar example so that future users will not be confused by this case.~~ see https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/9315#issuecomment-808765706 - Otherwise, if this is considered a bug then please see https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/8177#discussion_r579386002 for details on how it may be fixed.

column3: Pitest2 job fails when image is upgraded to ubuntu-2004:202010-01
column4: Found in https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9347  Failed job example - https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/checkstyle/checkstyle/5124/workflows/220e91e8-c339-488c-b5ce-28eb3f7fe60f/jobs/76104  https://76104-12499251-gh.circle-artifacts.com/2/target/pit-reports/202103041747/com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle/Main.java.html ```` Command: ./.ci/pitest.sh pitest-main  Diff: --- target/ignored.txt	2021-03-04 17:48:40.973777695 +0000 +++ target/actual.txt	2021-03-04 17:48:40.973777695 +0000 @@ -0,0 +1 @@ +Main.java.html:        } Difference between 'Actual' and 'Ignore' lists is detected, lists should be equal. ````  Failure looks weird.  Steps to reproduce - change machine attribute  ` machine: true`  to ``` machine:    image: ubuntu-2004:202010-01 ```  This issue blocks circle ci from upgrading image and using more advanced options.

column3: minor: remove redundant sonar file
column4: Found in https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9276#discussion_r575886821

column3: minor: fix anchors for generated pages
column4: Found during https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9183  In generated pages, e.g. for project summary, anchors for subsection are broken. For example https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/fix_button_2021113707/summary.html  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/812984/104815563-26268100-57ca-11eb-96f7-570a70268843.png)

column3: Generated link is incorrect if fork branch name has hash sign
column4: Found during #9288   Patch branch has `#` in it, so github action takes branch name and includes this into link. Generated link looks like https://checkstyle-diff-reports.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/Issue_#9271_2021125041/reports/diff/index.html, but it is incorrect(shows access denied) because `#` is a special sign.  Possible solutions - exclude hash sign from branch name or take hash from branch name and use it instead of branch name

column3: Remove DetailAstImpl usages from main code
column4: Found at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9264  RightCurlyCheck has usages.  After it, violations should be removed from import control file https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/7c7958a6004f3a0bd4c9444027ecdffc8ae9353f/config/import-control.xml#L18

column3: 'isDistributedPreviousStatement' return wrong result when previous line is a comment
column4: For the following code ```java     void foo() {         List.of(1, 2, 3).stream()                 .map(x -> x * x)                 .filter(x -> x % 2 != 0)                 // comment 1                 .collect(Collectors.toList());         // comment 2     } ``` `CommentsIndentationCheck.isDistributedPreviousStatement(comment2)` should return true but returns false.  In some cases, this will produce false warning. ```plain [WARN] ~\src\Test.java:11:9: Comment has incorrect indentation level 8, expected is 16 ```  The reason for this bug is similar to #9105 .  `isDistributedExpression`  try to find the first token of the statement. It should find `List`, but the comment1 breaks the flow and it returns the comment.  I think I can fix it.

fixes Issue #5982:  ![import doc](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49342895/113508931-677c3080-9570-11eb-94c3-7a72ff7c15b4.PNG)  Output of  first example with no value parameters in command line:-  ``` $ cat config.xml                                         ``` ``` $ cat Test.java  import static java.io.File.listRoots; import static javax.swing.WindowConstants.*; // OK import static java.io.File.createTempFile; // violation should be before javax import static com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports.avoidstaticimport.InputAvoidStaticImportNestedClass.InnerClass;  // violation should be before java and javax  public class Test{ 	 } ``` 2 violations as in code  ``` $ java -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java  Starting audit... [ERROR] C:\Users
ares\Downloads\checkstyle\Test.java:3:1: Wrong order for 'java.io.File.createTempFile' import. [ImportOrder] [ERROR] C:\Users
ares\Downloads\checkstyle\Test.java:4:1: Wrong order for 'com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports.avoidstaticimport.InputAvoidStaticImportNestedClass.InnerClas s' import. [ImportOrder] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors.  ``` 2nd Example with value parameters  ``` $ cat config.xml                                                ``` ``` $ cat Test.java  import static java.io.File.listRoots; // OK import static javax.swing.WindowConstants.*; // OK import static java.io.File.createTempFile; // violation should be before javax import static com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports.avoidstaticimport .InputAvoidStaticImportNestedClass.InnerClass;  // OK import static com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports.avoidstaticimport .InputAvoidStaticImportNestedClass.InnerClass.one; // OK  public class SomeClass { }  public class Test{ 	 } ``` 2 violations as in code  ``` $ java -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java  Starting audit... [ERROR] C:\Users
ares\Downloads\checkstyle\Test.java:3:1: Wrong order for 'java.io.File.createTempFile' import. [ImportOrder] [ERROR] C:\Users
ares\Downloads\checkstyle\Test.java:4:1: Wrong order for 'com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports.avoidstaticimport.InputAvoidStaticImportNestedClass.InnerClas s' import. [ImportOrder] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors.  ```

column3: Correct NoEnumTrailingCheck and UnnessaryEnumSemicolonCheck to handle empty enums
column4: Fixes for #8653  NoEnumTrailingCheck is rewritten to handle empty enums with only comma as well (there was no violation before since it inspected ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF token instead of ENUM_DEF). UnnessaryEnumSemicolonCheck test inputs were extended with enum with only comma.

column3: #Issue #9310: test inputs should be compilable with javac11
column4: Fixes #9310  The import `sun.*` replaced with `sun.reflect.*`, `sun.applet.*` replaced with `sun.misc.*`,   The annotation `javax.annotation.Generated` replaced with `java.lang.SuppressWarnings`.  Two new build configs for semaphore CI with `java.version=11`: one for OpenJdk11 javac, another for Eclipse compiler.

column3: Issue #9297: solve spotbugs violations for java 11
column4: Fixes #9297   Violations for `AbstractCheck` and `AbstractFileSetCheck` are suppressed.  Methods `setFileContents` and `clearMessages` are part of the public API, so it's hard to change them.  The field `JavadocDetailNodeParser#errorListener` is a local variable now.

column3: minor: Fix github issue template not working
column4: Fixes #9285: The template is read from the first line, since the first line doesn't matchup with the github extensible template, it is failing to create an issue template.

column3: Issue #9138: Create MatchXpath instance to forbid usage of "@Issue"
column4: Fixes #9138  This check will raise violation at each `@Issue` annotation used in a Java source file. I have placed the check module in the "coding" sub-section of `checkstyle_checks.xml`, in alphabetical order. Let me know if I should make any changes.  ### Check Module `$ cat config.xml` ```xml  		                                ```  ### Source  `$ cat Test.java` ```java import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;  public class Test {    @Test   @Issue("https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/9138")   public void method1() throws Exception {     int a = 1;     assertEquals(1, a);   }    @Issue("https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/9138")   @Test   public void method2() {     int a = 1;     assertEquals(5, a);   }    @Test   public void noIssue() {     assertTrue(true);   } } ```  ### Output `$ java com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main -c config.xml test.java` ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/CheckstyleExperiments/MatchXPath_avoidIssue/testFile.java:6:3: Avoid using @Issue annotation. [MatchXpath] [ERROR] /home/ayushman/Desktop/CheckstyleExperiments/MatchXPath_avoidIssue/testFile.java:12:3: Avoid using @Issue annotation. [MatchXpath] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors. ```

column3: Issue #7877: Removed redundant conditional
column4: Fixes #7877   **Pitest Report before fix:** https://bossever.github.io/issue7877/pit-reports/202102122217/com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports/ImportOrderCheck.java.html#org.pitest.mutationtest.report.html.SourceFile@476dda8b_878  [Hardcoded mutation on line 878](https://github.com/bossever/checkstyle/commit/7e0c2b518fe06f41175f1106d1d3bb1e9b00ca32): `removed conditional - replaced equality check with true → SURVIVED`  **Pitest Report after fix:** https://bossever.github.io/issue7877/pit-reports/202102182308/com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.imports/index.html  ### Rationale behind removing `!beforeFirstImport` I tried coming up with test cases where the mutation could be killed, but came to the conclusion that there exists no such test case, please read comment on issue - https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/7877#issuecomment-781327096. As @nmancus1 has pointed out in issue conversation, I suppose this condition can be safely removed if no test cases were found, and `mvn clean verify` is passing.  Please let me know if I have missed anything, or if there is another way to fix this issue. _____________________________________________________________________________  Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/bossever/ff126a13b0f1422daa5626db6fcdc384/raw/96d1898cdc28233c7a7fef6b3f855b939b2cf694/config.xml  Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/bossever/ff126a13b0f1422daa5626db6fcdc384/raw/6e8f8cbf0eb40baaf072ec9a3fe93883614709a9/projects-to-test-on.properties   Report label: Diff Regression Report after fix

column3: Issue #9280: replace `Scope` with `AccessModifierOption` in JavadocVariableCheck
column4: fix for #9280  In `JavadocVariableCheck`, replace `Scope scope` and `Scope excludeScope` by `AccessModifierOption[] accessModifiers`.  Whether the JavadocVariableCheck is applied to a given variable still depends on the variable's modifier *and on the variable's surrounding scope*, like it was before. I.e. to run the check on a `public` field in a `private` class, `accessModifiers` must include `private`, but not necessarily `public`. If it was intended to change this behaviour, let me know.

column3: Issue #8548: reformulate regex to fix Sonar warning
column4: fix for #8548  Rewrite the regex field `JavadocPropertiesGenerator.END_OF_SENTENCE_PATTERN`, to fix [this SonarQube warning](https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=org.checkstyle%3Acheckstyle&issues=AXN1aAJJvRinlJ3puDUg&open=AXN1aAJJvRinlJ3puDUg).  * `(.*?[.?!])(\s|$)` - the original regex * `([^.?!]*+[.?!])(\s|$)` - what SonarQube suggested * `(([^.?!]|[.?!](?!\s|$))*+[.?!])(\s|$)` - what I used in the end  The problem with Sonar's suggestion is that it matches different things than the original pattern. For the input "Get obj.field.", their suggestion matches "field.", while the original pattern and my solution match the whole string.  The regex is a bit complex now. An alternative solution could be to write some Java code for finding the first sentence.  edit: fixed 3rd regex

column3: ForceStrictCondition should not affect individual array elements.
column4: Extended from https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/8083#discussion_r534196175  javac Test.java  ``` No output ```   $ cat Test.java ```java @InputIndentationAnnArrInit2.Foo({ //indent:0 exp:0             @InputIndentationAnnArrInit2.Bar, //indent:12 exp:>=2 // should not allow this indentation.             // because the element should only follow arrayInit, LineWrapping and basicOffset             //  and no other except that             // moreover, currently it is also following forceStrictCondition, due to which             // the results/checkstyle output is changed with              // changing value of forceStrictCondition which should not be, because             // it is not a lineWrapped element but an array child. }) //indent:0 exp:0  // helper code class InputIndentationAnnArrInit2 { //indent:0 exp:0   @interface Foo { //indent:2 exp:2     Bar[] value() default {}; //indent:4 exp:4      String[] values() default {"Hello", "Checkstyle"}; //indent:4 exp:4   } //indent:2 exp:2    @interface Bar {} //indent:2 exp:2 } //indent:0 exp:0 ```  $ cat config.xml ```xml                                                                          ```  # Actual Behaviour $ java -jar checkstyle-8.38-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java  ``` Starting audit... Audit done. ```  # Expected Behaviour Error on line 2 ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /Test.java:2:13: 'annotation array initialization' child has incorrect indentation level 12,           expected level should be one of the following: 2, 8, 35, 41. [Indentation] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```      Verbal   **Concise description:** Currently after merging PR #8083, annotation array initialization is supporting forceStrictCondition false and true properties. Though the element indentation is made more flexible now, but it is somewhere not relatable to documentation of checkstyle upon array init indentation.  The array elements should follow arrayinit Indentation and thus it should not care by forceStrictCondition. because according to documentation:  > Force strict indent level in line wrapping case. If value is true, line wrap indent have to be same as lineWrappingIndentation parameter. If value is false, line wrap indent could be bigger on any value user would like.  ForceStrictCondition should only be useful with lineWrapping.  **Describe the solution** remove support for flexible indent levels for array children, they should follow pattern before merging PR #8038 for arrayInitializations.  **A doubt** In array Initilizations we were following arrayInit, basicOffset, and linewrapping, so that user could get some flexibilty with their config, or for making the placements of children less confusing. But since we were using lineWrapping there, can't we have it benefits of forceStrictCondition false and  any indent level after minimum requirement.

column3: Eclipse plugin: Do not fail if a (new) configuration property does not exist
column4: Eclipse user here.  We commit checkstyle configuration within our SCM / Eclipse workspace projects. In addition, we use different versions of the checkstyle plugin.  Today, I did an upgrade of checkstyle to version 8.35 and got the following error. The error reason is expectable, as the commited configuration file does indeed not contain the new property '`allowMissingPropertyJavadoc`' (and I'm unsure when adding this property if the older eclipse checkstyle plugins will fail). It looks like this error disabled checkstyle completely within my Eclipse.  This hinders multi-version environments and upgrade tests.  Ideally, checkstyle would only warn that there's a configuration issue but continue with a best-effort approach.   ``` com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: cannot initialize module TreeWalker - cannot initialize module JavadocMethod - Property 'allowMissingPropertyJavadoc' does not exist, please check the documentation 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:482) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201) 	at net.sf.eclipsecs.core.builder.CheckerFactory.createCheckerInternal(CheckerFactory.java:240) 	at net.sf.eclipsecs.core.builder.CheckerFactory.createChecker(CheckerFactory.java:122) 	at net.sf.eclipsecs.core.builder.Auditor.runAudit(Auditor.java:139) 	at net.sf.eclipsecs.core.builder.CheckstyleBuilder.handleBuildSelection(CheckstyleBuilder.java:307) 	at net.sf.eclipsecs.core.jobs.RunCheckstyleOnFilesJob.runInWorkspace(RunCheckstyleOnFilesJob.java:119) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:42) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:63) Caused by: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: cannot initialize module JavadocMethod - Property 'allowMissingPropertyJavadoc' does not exist, please check the documentation 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.setupChild(TreeWalker.java:125) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:201) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Checker.setupChild(Checker.java:477) 	... 8 more Caused by: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.CheckstyleException: Property 'allowMissingPropertyJavadoc' does not exist, please check the documentation 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.tryCopyProperty(AutomaticBean.java:227) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.AutomaticBean.configure(AutomaticBean.java:194) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker.setupChild(TreeWalker.java:120) 	... 10 more  ```

column3: Improve contribution documentation regarding commit messages
column4: Documentation: https://checkstyle.org/contributing.html#Build Noticed at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9364  From https://checkstyle.org/contributing.html#Submitting_your_contribution: >Small changes of configuration files, documentation fixes, etc. can be contributed by starting the commit message with one of "minor:", "config:", "infra:", "doc:", "dependency:" or "spelling:", followed by a space and a brief single-line message.  We should elaborate on exactly what sort of changes are expected in each type of commit, and maybe even include a link to an example for each. The usage of other commit tags may be obvious to frequent contributors, but not to newcomers.

column3: Unresolvable indentation violation for method definition parenthesis
column4: Discovered during review at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9157#discussion_r572362892  Check documentation: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_misc.html#Indentation  Intellij auto-formats parenthesis to an indent of 12 spaces for the following code:  ```bash ➜  src javac TestClass.java   ➜  src cat config.xml                                                                                                                 ➜  src cat TestClass.java  public class TestClass {     void         method             (             )     {     } } ➜  src java -jar checkstyle-8.40-all.jar -c config.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/nick/Desktop/Tester/src/TestClass.java:4:13: 'method def lparen' has incorrect indentation level 12, expected level should be 4. [Indentation] [ERROR] /home/nick/Desktop/Tester/src/TestClass.java:5:13: 'method def rparen' has incorrect indentation level 12, expected level should be 4. [Indentation] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors.  ```  Ok, so following the above violations, we correct the code as specified:  ```bash  ➜  src cat TestClass.java  public class TestClass {     void         method     (     )     {     } }  ➜  src java -jar checkstyle-8.40-all.jar -c config.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/nick/Desktop/Tester/src/TestClass.java:4:5: '(' has incorrect indentation level 4, expected level should be 8. [Indentation] [ERROR] /home/nick/Desktop/Tester/src/TestClass.java:5:5: 'PARAMETERS' has incorrect indentation level 4, expected level should be 8. [Indentation] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors.  ```  Now, not only has the indentation specification changed, but so has the messages for the tokens in question.  So we follow the new specification:  ```bash  ➜  src cat TestClass.java                                             public class TestClass {     void         method         (         )     {     } }  ➜  src java -jar checkstyle-8.40-all.jar -c config.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/nick/Desktop/Tester/src/TestClass.java:4:9: 'method def lparen' has incorrect indentation level 8, expected level should be 4. [Indentation] [ERROR] /home/nick/Desktop/Tester/src/TestClass.java:5:9: 'method def rparen' has incorrect indentation level 8, expected level should be 4. [Indentation] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 2 errors.  ``` And repeat.

column3: Metadata generation fails on line wrapped type description
column4: Discovered at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9076#discussion_r559056728, when a check's class level javadoc  property description is line wrapped in  mid-sentence, metadata generation is incomplete.  From https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9076:  ```java   * Property {@code requiredJavadocPhrase} - Specify the comment text pattern which qualifies a  * method as designed for extension. Supports multi-line regex. Type is  * {@code java.util.regex.Pattern}.  * Default value is {@code ".*"}.  ```  Yields: ```xml                                             ``` Also,  ```java   * Property {@code requiredJavadocPhrase} - Specify the comment text pattern which qualifies a  * method as designed for extension. Type is {@code java.util.regex.Pattern}.  * Default value is {@code ".*"}.  *  ```  Yields: ```xml                              Specify the comment text pattern which qualifies a               ``` -----  **The following is outdated and incorrect, and can be fixed at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9209:**  During a fix remove from configs:  In `config/checkstyle_non_main_files_suppressions.xml`: ```xml      ```   In `config/suppressions.xml`: ```xml       ```

column3: EmptyLineSeparator: fix message and documentation
column4: detected at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9707#issuecomment-812521756  TODO: 1) update message  `empty.line.separator=''{0}'' should be separated from previous statement.` to mention "comments" or "from previous line" or create new message. It should be some thing like `''{0}'' should be separated by empty line from next block or statement or comment``  2) update default example with code I provided in PR comment  3) description of Check should explain that we do validation not for "after" but from current line to previous line and there might be comments/blocks/.../anything (not only statements)

[5:41]     |   |   |   |       |   |   |--NEWLINE -> 
 [5:42]     |   |   |   |       |   |   |--LEADING_ASTERISK ->      * [6:0]     |   |   |   |       |   |   `--TEXT ->   [6:6]     |   |   |   |       |   `--JAVADOC_INLINE_TAG_END -> } [6:7]     |   |   |   |       |--NEWLINE -> 
 [6:8]     |   |   |   |       |--TEXT ->       [7:0]     |   |   |   |       `--EOF ->  [7:5]     |   |   |   `--BLOCK_COMMENT_END -> */ [7:5]     |   |   `--LITERAL_PRIVATE -> private [8:4]     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [8:12]     |   |   `--LITERAL_VOID -> void [8:12]     |   |--IDENT -> foo3 [8:17]     |   |--LPAREN -> ( [8:21]     |   |--PARAMETERS -> PARAMETERS [8:22]     |   |--RPAREN -> ) [8:22]     |   `--SLIST -> { [8:24]     |       `--RCURLY -> } [8:25]     |--SINGLE_LINE_COMMENT -> // [8:27]     |   `--COMMENT_CONTENT ->  ok
 [8:29]     `--RCURLY -> } [11:0] ```  there is no easy way to get content of summary tag. We need util method that will traverse AST to concatenate all values.

column3: Indentation: change in violation message 'operator new' to just 'new'
column4: detected at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9079#discussion_r537059728  message is like `'operator new' has incorrect indentation level 20, expected level should be 16.` but all other messages do not have `operator` in name  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/812984/102727991-22443380-42de-11eb-8de0-a261f667012c.png)  Expected: remove `operator` word from message.

column3: XdocsPagesTest.testAllXmlExamples does not catch that config XML is not valid
column4: detected at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9011#discussion_r528363349  We have had this validation for long time. I believe it was the first XDoc validation I created.  It validates XDoc, not javadoc from your example. The XDoc/Javadoc test will sync up the xdoc in it's run.  There is a secondary issue for why the example error was not found.  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/de2f537d42a0165709c40b74a1757822814d22eb/src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/internal/XdocsPagesTest.java#L362  All XML examples are suppose to be in `source` while this one is in a `div` and `pre`. This is why validation didn't catch it.  We should fix the `source` tag here, and then examine how we can ensure all examples are in `source` and nothing else.

column3: TrailingComment report violation on comment at the begining of line
column4: detected at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/8711  detected problem: ```      /*package*/ void setAutoflush(boolean autoflush) {          this.autoflush = autoflush;      } ``` There should be no violation on this code    We need to avoid usage of following code https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/41769cee1881c8c92cc59762b90b83529406208a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/TrailingCommentCheck.java#L191-L195  and use only AST based code, as all content of comments is present in tree.

column3: Unclear message for wrong order Checks
column4: DeclarationOrderCheck ImportOrderCheck  "Variable access definition in wrong order" "Wrong order for 'xxx' import"   These messages do not indicate possible solutions, not even details of what is "wrong" that is almost certainly already available without further work, like: '"public static" should be after "private static"'. They do not even tell whether the thing  should be moved up or down.  With some extra work the message might indicate where should the thing go: "Should be after 'import yyy'" or similar.  Note: these are "style rules" because the order is not really important. Correspondingly, learning these rules is a nuissance I would rather skip if possible.

column3: JavadocMethod: new property to alllow missed type param
column4: Currently, JavadocMethod supports switches/properties to allow missing param tag and missing return tag: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_javadoc.html#JavadocMethod  I'd like to be able to enforce all method parameters to be present in javadoc (fail if missing), but not the generic types (allow missing type param). Therefore, I propose to add one additional property _allowMissingTypeParamTags_ which is true by default. It might cause upgrade issues for those using allowMissingParamTags, but is cleaner than having some switch applied when other switch is true.  I can provide pull request with implementation, if you decide to include this feature and that this is the correct way.  ``` $ cat config.xml                              $ cat Test.java  public interface Test {   /**     * This method will not be reported due to missing param      * @param variable     * @return bla bla     */    T methodWithCorrectJavadoc(T variable);     /**     * Report this method due to missing param variable     * @return bla bla     */    T methodWithIncorrectJavadoc(T variable); // missed param in javadoc     /**     * This method is completely correct, but we try to avoid descrition of      * @param  the type of the value     * @param variable     * @return bla bla     */    T methodWithCorrectJavadocForAll(T variable);  }  $ java -jar checkstyle-8.42-all.jar -c config.xml  Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:7:4: Expected @param tag for ''. [JavadocMethod] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:13:4: Expected @param tag for ''. [JavadocMethod] [ERROR] /var/tmp/Test.java:13:38: Expected @param tag for 'variable'. [JavadocMethod] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 3 errors. ```  With new property I expect to have no vilations with message `Expected @param tag for ''.`

column3: LITERAL_SWITCH token support in RightCurlyCheck
column4: Currently [RightCurlyCheck](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_blocks.html#RightCurly) accepts a lot less tokens (18 tokens) than [LeftCurlyCheck](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_blocks.html#LeftCurly) (24 tokens). It is unclear if this is just a mistake or if there is some underlying reason. This issue aims at adding support for `LITERAL_SWITCH` token in `RightCurlyCheck`.  Solving this issue will help solve Issue #3547(Child issue of #3547).  For **LeftCurlyCheck**:- ``` $ cat Test.java public class Test{     public static void foo() {         switch (mode) { // violation             case 1:                 x = 1;                 break;             default :                 x = 0;         }     } }  $ cat config_for_LITERALSwitch.xml                                                                   $ java -jar checkstyle-8.42-all.jar -c config_for_LITERALSwitch.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/devansu/Java_Development/Test.java:3:23: '{' at column 23 should be on a new line. [LeftCurly] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  For **RightCurlyCheck**:- ``` $ cat Test.java public class Test{     public static void foo() {         switch (mode) {             case 1:                 x = 1;                 break;             default :                 x = 0; } // expected violation     } }   $ cat config_for_LITERALSwitch.xml                                                    $ java -jar checkstyle-8.42-all.jar -c config_for_LITERALSwitch.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ``` Expected:- Violation for the right curly brace(on 4:27) or a way to enable violation on this token.

column3: LITERAL_DEFAULT token support in RightCurlyCheck
column4: Currently [RightCurlyCheck](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_blocks.html#RightCurly) accepts a lot less tokens (18 tokens) than [LeftCurlyCheck](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_blocks.html#LeftCurly) (24 tokens). It is unclear if this is just a mistake or if there is some underlying reason. This issue aims at adding support for `LITERAL_DEFAULT` token in `RightCurlyCheck`.  Solving this issue will help solve Issue #3547(Child issue of #3547).  ``` $ cat Test.java public class Test {     public static void foo() {         switch (type) {             case 1: {                 x = 1;                 break;             }             default: {                 x = 3; } // expected violation         } // no violation since token not in RightCurlyCheck.     } }  $ cat config_for_LITERALdefault.xml                                                    $ java -jar checkstyle-8.42-all.jar -c config_for_LITERALdefault.xml Test.java Starting audit... Audit done. ``` Expected:- Violation for the right curly brace(on 9:24) or a way to enable violation on this token.

column3: please make issue template executable
column4: creating an example shouldn't take so long and only require you to modify a little bit. It looks like you want this to execute, but it is not executable. Suggested unix template  ~~~md ```bash cd /var/tmp cat  Application.java import java.util.Objects;    class Application {     public static void main( String[] args ) { // Your code     } }  JAVA  cat  config.xml                                                                                                                                                                                                            # tmp           CONFIG  javac Application.java wget https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/releases/download/checkstyle-8.42/checkstyle-8.42-all.jar  RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-8.42-all.jar -c config.xml Application.java ``` ~~~

column3: New Check WhitespaceAroundArrayInitialization
column4: Continuing #3203  Code:- ``` class T {   int[] arr = {1,2}; } ``` Config:- ```                                            ``` ``` $ java -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -c c.xml T.java Starting audit... Audit done. ``` The code above with config specified does not raise any violation. After a few trials, it was decided to make a new check for this. https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/9239#issuecomment-787030185  To resolve this issue, we should:  1. Remove ARRAY_INIT token from WhitespaceAround 2. Add some documentation to WhitespaceAround that this check does not verify whitespace around array initialization, citing https://google.github.io/styleguide/javaguide.html#s4.8.3.1-array-initializers

column4: Closes: #9593 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56120837/115120145-82678f80-9fc9-11eb-86f4-24e84e7ce58e.png)  **Successfully Compiled** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56120837/115120159-93180580-9fc9-11eb-9b35-ec44cc588a74.png)  **Test.java** `λ cat Test.java` ``` public class Test {         void test() {                 int a = 10, b = 5;                 a = -b;         } } ```  **AST** `λ java -jar checkstyle-8.41.1-all.jar -t Test.java` ``` CLASS_DEF -> CLASS_DEF [1:0] |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [1:0] |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [1:0] |--LITERAL_CLASS -> class [1:7] |--IDENT -> Test [1:13] `--OBJBLOCK -> OBJBLOCK [1:18]     |--LCURLY -> { [1:18]     |--METHOD_DEF -> METHOD_DEF [2:1]     |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [2:1]     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [2:1]     |   |   `--LITERAL_VOID -> void [2:1]     |   |--IDENT -> test [2:6]     |   |--LPAREN -> ( [2:10]     |   |--PARAMETERS -> PARAMETERS [2:11]     |   |--RPAREN -> ) [2:11]     |   `--SLIST -> { [2:13]     |       |--VARIABLE_DEF -> VARIABLE_DEF [3:2]     |       |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [3:2]     |       |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [3:2]     |       |   |   `--LITERAL_INT -> int [3:2]     |       |   |--IDENT -> a [3:6]     |       |   `--ASSIGN -> = [3:8]     |       |       `--EXPR -> EXPR [3:10]     |       |           `--NUM_INT -> 10 [3:10]     |       |--COMMA -> , [3:12]     |       |--VARIABLE_DEF -> VARIABLE_DEF [3:2]     |       |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [3:2]     |       |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [3:2]     |       |   |   `--LITERAL_INT -> int [3:2]     |       |   |--IDENT -> b [3:14]     |       |   `--ASSIGN -> = [3:16]     |       |       `--EXPR -> EXPR [3:18]     |       |           `--NUM_INT -> 5 [3:18]     |       |--SEMI -> ; [5:15]     |       |--LITERAL_IF -> if [6:0]     |       |   |--LPAREN -> ( [6:2]     |       |   |--EXPR -> EXPR [6:4]     |       |   |   `--EQUAL -> == [6:4]     |       |   |       |--IDENT -> c [6:3]     |       |   |       `--NUM_INT -> 1 [6:6]     |       |   |--RPAREN -> ) [6:7]     |       |   `--SLIST -> { [6:9]     |       |       |--EXPR -> EXPR [7:5]     |       |       |   `--ASSIGN -> = [7:5]     |       |       |       |--IDENT -> c [7:4]     |       |       |       `--NUM_INT -> 0 [7:6]     |       |       |--SEMI -> ;       `--RCURLY -> } ```

column3: Issue #9543: Added Example of AST for TokenTypes.NOT_EQUAL
column4: Closes: #9543  ![Screenshot 2021-03-21 at 7 03 35 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36664705/111906854-c1f99500-8a78-11eb-902f-48d321a3e3cd.png)  ``` $ javac Tester.java  $ cat Tester.java public class Tester { 	public static boolean my(int a, int b) { 		return a != b; 	} }   $ java -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -T Tester.java  CLASS_DEF -> CLASS_DEF [2:0] |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [2:0] |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [2:0] |--LITERAL_CLASS -> class [2:7] |--IDENT -> Tester [2:13] `--OBJBLOCK -> OBJBLOCK [2:20]     |--LCURLY -> { [2:20]     |--METHOD_DEF -> METHOD_DEF [3:1]     |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [3:1]     |   |   |--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [3:1]     |   |   `--LITERAL_STATIC -> static [3:8]     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [3:15]     |   |   `--IDENT -> Boolean [3:15]     |   |--IDENT -> test [3:23]     |   |--LPAREN -> ( [3:27]     |   |--PARAMETERS -> PARAMETERS [3:28]     |   |   |--PARAMETER_DEF -> PARAMETER_DEF [3:28]     |   |   |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [3:28]     |   |   |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [3:28]     |   |   |   |   `--LITERAL_INT -> int [3:28]     |   |   |   `--IDENT -> a [3:32]     |   |   |--COMMA -> , [3:33]     |   |   `--PARAMETER_DEF -> PARAMETER_DEF [3:35]     |   |       |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [3:35]     |   |       |--TYPE -> TYPE [3:35]     |   |       |   `--LITERAL_INT -> int [3:35]     |   |       `--IDENT -> b [3:39]     |   |--RPAREN -> ) [3:40]     |   `--SLIST -> { [3:42]     |       |--LITERAL_RETURN -> return [4:2]     |       |   |--EXPR -> EXPR [4:11]     |       |   |   `--NOT_EQUAL -> != [4:11]     |       |   |       |--IDENT -> a [4:9]     |       |   |       `--IDENT -> b [4:14]     |       |   `--SEMI -> ; [4:15]     |       `--RCURLY -> } [5:1]     `--RCURLY -> } [6:0]  Printing a line for the code we care $ java -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -T Tester.java | grep "4:"     |       |--LITERAL_RETURN -> return [4:2]     |       |   |--EXPR -> EXPR [4:11]     |       |   |   `--NOT_EQUAL -> != [4:11]     |       |   |       |--IDENT -> a [4:9]     |       |   |       `--IDENT -> b [4:14]     |       |   `--SEMI -> ; [4:15] ``` Expected update for javadoc  ```  |--EXPR -> EXPR  |   `--NOT_EQUAL -> !=  |       |--IDENT -> a  |       `--IDENT -> b  `--SEMI -> ; ```
