[ERROR] /var/tmp/Application.java:6:29: '8' is a magic number. [MagicNumber] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  this doesn't  ``` +--- com.puppycrawl.tools:checkstyle:{strictly 8.37} -> 8.37 (c) ```

column3: FinalClass should exempt private-only constructor classes that also have nested subclasses
column4: ```bash $ cat Test.java ```  ```java public class Test {      public static final Test ONE = new Test() {         @Override         public int value() {             return 1;         }     };      private Test() {     }      public int value() {         return 0;     } } ```  ```bash $ cat config.xml ```  ```xml                        ```  ```bash $ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" $ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -c config.xml Test.java Starting audit... [ERROR] /Users/archie/bugs/checkstyle-A/Test.java:1:1: Class Test should be declared as final. [FinalClass] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ```  The `FinalClass` module is doing it's job correctly in that it's detecting a non-final class with only private constructor(s), but it's not smart enough to realize that in some situations - e.g., this particular situation where you are defining nested classes within the outer class - it's not possible to make the class `final` because otherwise those nested classes would be impossible to write, because the compile would fail because you can't extend a final class.  Java allows nested classes to extend a class using a private superclass constructor. So the upshot is that `FinalClass` should make an exception when the class being checked contains any nested subclasses.

column3: RequireEmptyLineBeforeBlockTagGroup: false positive on line with only single space
column4: ```` $ cat TestClass.java public class TestClass {     /**      * Method.      *       * @throws Exception      *             if there is an error.      */     void method() throws Exception {     } }  $ cat TestConfig.xml                        $ java -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -c TestConfig.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... [ERROR] TestClass.java:5: Javadoc tag '@throws' should be preceded with an empty line. [RequireEmptyLineBeforeBlockTagGroup] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors. ````  It is not clear from the report, but the line 5 contains only spaces and the asterisk. What makes this line special is that there is an extra space after the asterisk on the line.  Eclipse's javadoc creation likes to put in these spaces when using it to start the Javadoc.  I am looking for lines like this to not be reported. The line is empty only containing the asterisk and spaces.

column3: Upgrade to GitHub-native Dependabot
column4: _Dependabot Preview will be shut down on August 3rd, 2021. In order to keep getting Dependabot updates, please merge this PR and migrate to GitHub-native Dependabot before then._  Dependabot has been fully integrated into GitHub, so you no longer have to install and manage a separate app. This pull request updates your config file to the [new syntax][new_syntax]. When merged, we'll swap out `dependabot-preview` (me) for a new `dependabot` app, and you'll be all set!  With this change, you'll now use the [Dependabot page in GitHub][dependabot_page], rather than the [Dependabot dashboard][dashboard], to monitor your version updates, and you'll configure Dependabot through the new config file rather than a UI.        If you've got any questions or feedback for us, please let us know by creating an issue in the [dependabot/dependabot-core][issues] repository.  [Learn more about migrating to GitHub-native Dependabot][learn]  Please note that regular `@dependabot` commands do not work on this pull request.  [dashboard]: https://app.dependabot.com/ [dependabot_page]: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/network/updates [issues]: https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/issues/new?assignees=%40dependabot%2Fpreview-migration-reviewers&labels=E%3A+preview-migration&template=migration-issue.md [learn]: http://docs.github.com/code-security/supply-chain-security/upgrading-from-dependabotcom-to-github-native-dependabot [new_syntax]: https://help.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates [org_secrets_url]: https://github.com/organizations/checkstyle/settings/secrets/dependabot [repo_secrets_url]: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/settings/secrets/dependabot

column3: IntelliJ  project code style settings should enforce correct array initialization RCURLY indentation
column4: [We should create a default IntelliJ project code style](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9087439/how-to-share-code-style-settings-between-developers-in-intellij#:~:text=Code%20Style%20can%20be%20copied,scheme%20at%20the%20project%20level.) to deactivate "Align when multiline" in the "Array Initializer" code style settings (and others) to help auto-format fix the following:  Example:  ```java          final String[] expected = {             "14:2: " + getCheckMessage(MSG_SEMI),             "20:2: " + getCheckMessage(MSG_SEMI),             }; // should be aligned with definition  ```  Config can be used to find instances of this that need to be fixed:  ```xml                                                                                                                                 ```  Right now, this config produces 78 violations (all in unit test files): `checkstyle/config/ant-phase-verify.xml:174: Checkstyle failed: Got 78 errors and 0 warnings.`  Edit: I forgot about https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/wiki/Checkstyle-GSoC-2021-Project-Ideas#project-name-reconcile-formatters-of-eclipse--netbeans-and-intellij-idea-ides-by-checkstyle-config, but I will leave this up to remind us about this setting.

column3: Checkstyle should support "classpath:" protocol
column4: [Originally a Spring "psuedo URL"](https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/current/javadoc-api/org/springframework/util/ResourceUtils.html), `classpath:` as a protocol is becoming more prevalent.  Adding `classpath:` protocol support will help users to specify to Checkstyle where configs and such reside IN EXPLICIT way:  ``` ➜  src java -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c classpath:config.xml SomeClass.java Could not find config XML file 'classpath:config.xml'.  ``` This should tell Checkstyle to load `config.xml` using `ClassLoader.getSystemResource()` only.  Spring implementation: https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework/blob/master/spring-core/src/main/java/org/springframework/core/io/DefaultResourceLoader.java  Spring usage: https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/3.0.x/spring-framework-reference/html/resources.html#resources-classpath-wildcards  There is an existing Checkstyle PR for this here: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/8789/files, but without issue and more details/ discussion, we cannot move forward.

Did not understand what wrong with my code sample.

column3: Make "all" version available on maven central as well
column4: **How it works Now:**  I maintain a tool (company internal) That runs checkstyle as a pre-commit and pre-receive hook. This hook is compiled using an internal build process that does not have access to internet.   **The problem**  For every update of Checkstyle we need to 1. Be aware there is an update 2. Download `checkstyle-all.jar` from your GitHub releases 3. Store it in our servers to retrieve during builds.  This way has some drawbacks, for example we can't automate the update using Renovate/Dependabot or other automated tooling.  **Describe the solution you'd like**  Would it be possible to upload the `checkstyle-all.jar` release on your maven repository with a classifier so it can be taken from Maven Central ? Our Nexus mirror could then pick it up and we could automate that update.  I'm pretty sure we wouldn't be the only ones to benefit from this feature. I hope you'll consider it.  **Additional context** N/A  **Not a feature?** N/A

column3: Violation of the  priority rule in CustomImportOrder
column4: **Code:--**  package com.company;  import static java.lang.Math.*; // OK import static java.util.Scanner;//OK  import java.io.*; // OK import java.net.*; //OK import java.time.*; //OK import javax.net.ssl.SSLContext; //OK import javax.net.ssl.TrustManager; //OK import javax.net.ssl.X509TrustManager;//OK  import org.apache.http.conn.ClientConnectionManager; // OK import org.apache.http.conn.scheme.Scheme; //OK import org.apache.http.conn.scheme.SchemeRegistry;//OK import org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLSocketFactory; //OK import org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultHttpClient; //OK  **Configuration file:--** ```                                                       ```  **Command executed:---** java -jar checkstyle-8.39-all.jar -c config.xml   Hello.java  **Output generated:---** Starting audit... Audit done.  **Expected:---**  import static java.lang.Math.*; // OK import static java.util.Scanner;//OK  import java.io.*; // OK import java.net.*; //OK import java.time.*; //OK import javax.net.ssl.SSLContext; // VIOLATION import javax.net.ssl.TrustManager; //VIOLATION import javax.net.ssl.X509TrustManager;//VIOLATION  import org.apache.http.conn.ClientConnectionManager; // OK import org.apache.http.conn.scheme.Scheme; //OK import org.apache.http.conn.scheme.SchemeRegistry;//OK import org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLSocketFactory; //OK import org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultHttpClient; //OK  Statement:---The priority order as stated in the config file is  ``  is not holding true as  javax packages should come before the java packages  Same is the case with the org packages which should be in SAME PACKAGE group but is in SPECIAL IMPORT group.

column3: Issue #9553: updated example of AST for TokenTypes.PLUS
column4: ## closes issue #9553: updated example of AST for TokenTypes.PLUS    ``` anmolsharma@Anmols-MacBook-Pro GSOC % java -jar checkstyle-8.41-all.jar -t MyClass.java | grep "4:"     |       |--EXPR -> EXPR [4:10]     |       |   `--ASSIGN -> = [4:10]     |       |       |--IDENT -> a [4:8]     |       |       `--PLUS -> + [4:14]     |       |           |--IDENT -> b [4:12]     |       |           `--IDENT -> c [4:16]     |       |--SEMI -> ; [4:17] ```  expected update for javodoc is:  ``` |--EXPR -> EXPR |   `--ASSIGN -> = |       |--IDENT -> a |       `--PLUS -> + |           |--IDENT -> b |           `--IDENT -> c |--SEMI -> ; ```

column3: Issue: #9515
column4: # PLEASE READ before removing  Rules: 1) The issue you are trying to fix/resolve has to have the "approved" label. 2) Put in the description of Pull Request the reference to an issue if it exists.    Example: "Issue: #XXXXXX" 3) Commit message should adhere to the following rules:    a) MUST match one of the following patterns:       ^Issue #\\d+: .*$       ^Pull #\\d+: .*$       ^(minor|config|infra|doc|spelling|dependency): .*$    b) MUST contain only one line of text    c) MUST NOT end with a period, space, or tab    d) MUST be less than or equal to 200 characters  To avoid multiple iterations of fixes and CIs failures, please read https://checkstyle.org/contributing.html  ATTENTION: We are not merging Pull Requests that are not passing our CIs, but we will help to resolve issues.  Thanks for reading, remove whole this message and type what you need.
